title: Franchisee Challenges a Restaurant Chain, to the Benefit of Both
description: When Zane Tankel bought his first Applebees franchise in 1995 he was, for the most part, winging it.

title: Perry Campaign Stop Is Convenient for Reporters
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Presidential campaigns can be a logistical nightmare for Washington journalists, with lots of costly plane flights to small airports as they chase the candidates around the country.

title: Is It All Obamas Fault?
description: Gail Collins: David, Im so happy to be back conversing with you again! When I left in May you were very depressed about the way the country was going, but I see that things have changed and now youre really, really, really depressed about the way the country is going.

title: Interview: Matthew Goode
description: The actor Matthew Goode discusses his role in the Australian drama Burning Man.

title: Can an Applebees Franchisee Be a Real Entrepreneur?
description: Weve just published a lively small-business conversation with Zane Tankel, who bought into the established Applebees business model but who has also challenged that model in many ways, including what his employees wear, how they are hired and rewarded, where he builds his restaurants, and what food those restaurants serve. Based on revenue numbers confirmed by Applebees, the results have been impressive. Maybe this kind of thing isnt for the average franchisee, Mr. Tankel told Eilene Zimmerman, but we pushed the envelope right from the start, took those protocols to the next level, and I think thats entrepreneurship.

title: Michael Kors: Poor Mans Safari
description: Before the start of the Michael Kors show Wednesday morning, Rachel Zoe gamely fielded questions from style reporters near and far, but all they wanted to know about was her baby.

title: Matthew Goode Becomes Burning Man
description: TORONTO  The English actor Matthew Goode has appeared in a wide range of movies during his relatively brief film career, including a Woody Allen movie (Match Point), one inspired by a comic book (Watchmen) and a Hollywood romantic comedy (Leap Year). In the Australian drama Burning Man, he takes on one of his toughest acting challenges, as a chef who has experienced an event that would change his life permanently.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Michael Kors
description: Michael loves a bronze girl or boy, said Dick Page backstage at Michael Kors. This is a sort of rough glamor. Page used Shiseido Creme Shadow in Caviar, Leather and Sable to create strong eyebrows with Meadow gold spread on the lid and Caramel Perfect Rouge on the lips. Luminize Satin Face Color in BE 206 was mixed with Bronzer 1 and 2 all over the face to make sure the models didnt look like they had to get up at 6 a.m. to do a show. No one did. Its pretty, Hanne Gaby said of her tousled hair braided with black leather. I dont think Id be able to do it, though. Luckily, Orlando Pita was there to help create the look that came about based on one of Korss fantasy stories. (He embellished it more than I do, said Pita of the designers storytelling prowess.) The tales goes: These girls are on a trip in Africa with only shoelaces to tie back their hair. They groom themselves, said Pita. The front is all they can see. This explains why the hair around the face was more tidy, parted in the middle, while the back was wild and messy. Orlandos own Dry Shampoo was used with Bumble and Bumble Surf Spray to coat the hair before braiding. The tail was then teased up between the lacing and Pitas Elevate Texture Spray added. The model Magdalena Frackowiak offered a way to translate the look to her own routine: braid it loosely and then pull bits out.

title: A Congressman-Elect Wakes Up to His New Role
description: Bob Turner, who won a special election on Tuesday to replace Anthony D. Weiner in the Ninth Congressional district, emerged onto his porch in Rockaway Point, Queens, at 9:45 Wednesday morning in shorts and T-shirt and with bare feet, still somewhat groggy from his late-night victory party and surprised to find a reporter and photographer waiting in his yard.

title: Iacopo Falai Shuts His Flagship Restaurant, Citing Changing Neighborhood
description: Iacopo Falai has closed his first restaurant, Falai, on Clinton Street, which opened in 2005.

title: After Caxton, Another Hedge Fund Announces Leadership Handoff
description: Is succession in the air?

title: Jury Deliberations Begin in Gundlach Trial
description: Let the conclave begin.

title: Opel Rake Emphasizes Affordability in the Urban-Runabout Segment
description: FRANKFURT  Its designer called it a spaceship on wheels, but to this observer, the Opel Rake suggested Darth Vaders lawn mower, presuming Mr. Vader maintained a lawn.

title: BP Shortcuts Led to Gulf Oil Spill, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  BP, running weeks behind schedule and tens of millions of dollars over budget in trying to complete its troubled Macondo well in the Gulf of Mexico, took many shortcuts that contributed to the disastrous blowout and oil spill there last year, federal investigators concluded in a report released on Wednesday.

title: In Brussels, American vs. Belgian Beers
description: In Brussels, Moeder Lambic (8 Place Fontainas; 32-2-503-60-68) is among the most traditional of Belgian beer cafes, specializing in the obscure sour brews known as lambic and gueuze. By contrast, Californias Stone Brewing Company is among the most innovative of American brewers, turning out broad-shouldered double I.P.A.s and other highly hopped, high-octane ales with names like Sublimely Self-Righteous and Ruination.

title: Russia Again at Odds With West Over Election Monitors
description: MOSCOW  Russias top election official said Wednesday that Western election observers were proposing an overly large delegation to monitor parliamentary voting in December, raising the possibility of a standoff like the one that caused the cancellation of an observation mission four years ago.

title: Where the Big Girls Are | Narciso Rodriguez
description: The photographer JD Ferguson gets close up on the biggest faces in fashion.

title: New York Chooses Company to Run Bike-Share Program
description: The Bloomberg administration announced Wednesday it had selected a Portland, Ore., company to run an ambitious bike-share program in New York City, but dont break out the spandex cycling shorts just yet.

title: Separating Issues from Myths in Obamas Solyndra Situation
description: Brad Plumer of the Washington Post has filed a really nice, tight deconstruction of five myths being propagated in the wake of the failure of Solyndra, a solar company that received more than $500 million in fast-tracked loan guarantees from the Department of Energy and became a photo opp for President Obama last year. (A House committee held a hearing on the company and the administration this morning.)

title: The Worst of Times After Years of Success
description: LONDON  Fewer than two dozen Arsenal supporters gathered at the Herbert Chapman pub near Emirates Stadium, hoping to raise a glass in triumph but resigned to lower expectations.

title: NASA Unveils New Rocket Design
description: To push farther out into the solar system  to the moon and beyond, to asteroids, eventually to Mars  NASA unveiled plans on Wednesday for a behemoth rocket that would serve as the backbone of its human spaceflight program for decades.

title: The Caucus | G.O.P. Victory in New York
description: Sept. 14, 2011  Policy toward Israel was at the forefront of a House race in New York. Also, the issue of whether to inoculate preadolescent girls against HPV reverberates around the 2012 field.

title: The Season in Silhouette | The New Long
description: In this Fashion Week special, Ts Mallory Schlau sketches springs recurring silhouettes.

title: The Charms of Yellowstone in Winter
description: Its not too early to start booking a winter vacation, and though Yellowstone National Park may seem like an odd destination during the chillier months, Ken Burns, the documentary filmmaker, says it is one of the best times to visit.

title: Immigration Advocates Split Over Arizona Boycott
description: PHOENIX  The boycott of Arizona is on. No, the boycott of Arizona is off. Deciding whether to visit this state, which may or may not be boycotted, is as disorienting as peering into the depths of the Grand Canyon.

title: Pluck of the Irish: Shamrock Rovers Ready for Europa League
description: On a dramatic night in Belgrade in August, Stephen ODonnells penalty kick in the 113th minute of extra time secured for Shamrock Rovers, champions of Ireland, a place in the group stages of Europes second tier soccer competition, the Europa League, completing a 3-2 aggregate victory over Serbias Partizan Belgrade.

title: Disturbed Ax-Wielding Farmer Kills Six in Central Chinese City
description: BEIJING  A farmer described by the authorities as mentally ill rampaged through the streets of a city in central China with an ax on Wednesday morning, killing six people, two of them children, according to the state media.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: 'Drive'
description: Nicolas Winding Refn, the director of "Drive," narrates a scene from the film.

title: Some Banks Hang On to Bailout Billions
description: While it has been nearly three years since Washington bailed out the banks, the financial industry is still clinging to $19 billion in taxpayer money.

title: Battle Over Israels Barrier
description: Israel has been building a barrier around and through the West Bank since 2002. Israel's government says it protects against terrorism. Palestinians argue it is a an attempt to seize territory.

title: From the Halls of Harvard Into the Street, in Pursuit of a Senate Seat
description: BOSTON  Elizabeth Warren announced her candidacy for the United States Senate here on Wednesday and plunged into street-level politics, greeting commuters at a train stop at the outset of what could be a marquee Senate race of 2012.

title: With i30, Hyundai Fields Another Contender in the Hatchback Wars
description: FRANKFURT  The original Hyundai i30, marketed as the now-discontinued Elantra Touring in the United States, was a product of the Korean companys European designers and engineers. This latest Euro-born i30 is expected to carry the Elantra Touring name when it arrives in the United Sates, although Hyundai did not announce a timetable for the cars American introduction.

title: 4,600 Sea Turtles Killed Yearly by Fishing, Study Suggests
description: Some 4,600 sea turtles are killed each year by American fisheries, according to a new report published in the journal Biological Conservation.

title: Caucus Video: The Israel Issue in the G.O.P. Win in New York; HPV Reververbates in the 2012 Race
description: The issue of Israel was at the forefront of the G.O.P. upset in New Yorks special election. Also, whether to inoculate preadolescent girls against a sexually transmitted virus reverberates around the 2012 field.

title: The Knuckleballer
description: Before a decades worth of steroid revelations made their glowing press coverage seem like an exercise in self-deception, people liked to say that Mark McGwire and Sammy Sosa saved baseball in 1998  that their extraordinary home run surge revived fan enthusiasm and restored Americas interest in the sport after the ugliness of the World Series-canceling 1994 strike.

title: Making the Grade? Perry Says He Didnt
description: LYNCHBURG, Va.  As a child, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas was dead set on being a veterinarian. That was my hearts content. Its what I always wanted to do, he said.

title: Report on the Macondo Well Blowout
description: A 217-page report from the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Regulation and Enforcement on the causes of the Deepwater Horizon oil spill.

title: Brazilian Hair Treatment Comes Under F.D.A. Fire
description: A popular hair-straightening product called Brazilian Blowout, which has received scrutiny in recent months after tests found it contains significant amounts of the harmful chemical formaldehyde, has come under new government pressure. The United States Food and Drug Administration has stepped into the fray by warning the company that its product contains a poisonous or deleterious substance and that it was falsely labeled as formaldehyde-free.

title: White House Rankles Wall Street With Enterprise Value Tax
description: 8:00 p.m. | Updated

title: Photo Replay: Sept.14
description: The day in sports included pool play at the Rugby World Cup in New Zealand and quarterfinal basketball games at EuroBasket in Lithuania.

title: Europe Ponders Changes to Finance Ministers Group
description: BRUSSELS  Is Europe about to get a new Mr. Euro?

title: Renault-Nissan and Daimler Announce Plan to Share Components
description: FRANKFURT  In an example of how major shifts in technology are compelling carmakers to cooperate more closely to cut costs, Daimler and the Renault-Nissan Alliance said Wednesday they would expand their existing partnership to include components of new compact luxury vehicles and reaffirmed plans to share batteries and motors in electric cars.

title: Charges Likely Within Weeks for Officers in Tickets Case
description: A Bronx grand jury investigating police officers suspected of helping other officers friends and relatives  avoid paying traffic tickets is expected to issue criminal charges in the coming weeks against more than a dozen officers  a considerable number, but significantly fewer than originally anticipated, one lawyer involved in the case said Wednesday.

title: Fashion Week Casting | Reed Krakoff
description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#307", 592, 400, true, chameleonData);

title: Uninstalling Curiosity, the Video
description: The cover story of this weeks education issue, The Character Test, by Paul Tough, discusses an unusual curriculum taught at two very different schools in New York. Educators at KIPP Infinity, a charter school in Harlem, and Riverdale, a prestigious private school in the Bronx, are using special lesson plans to improve the character of their students. To illustrate the piece, we wanted to show the two school environments as well as express the idea of teaching traits like optimism, grit and curiosity.

title: Influential Rabbi Charged in a Rent-Subsidy Scheme
description: Rabbi Leib Glanz was a master of politics, a broker of favors who long served as a bridge between the clannish world of one of Brooklyns most powerful Jewish communities and a universe of candidates from the New York City Council to the presidency.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Drive
description: TORONTO  In Drive, directed by Nicolas Winding Refn, Ryan Gosling plays a man who works as a stunt driver for movies by day and an occasional getaway car driver by night. The film, screening here ahead of its Sept. 16 release in the United States, plays both as a psychological drama and a genre-focused crime movie. Here, Mr. Refn discusses a chase scene that happens early in the film and is primarily shot within the cars interior.

title: Pictures of the Day: Afghanistan and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Afghanistan, Libya, China and New Zealand.

title: Fashion Week Parties, Night 6
description: Scenes from Tuesday: AnOther, Marchesa, Fantastic Man and Rodarte.

title: Emmys Watch: Peter Berg on Friday Night Lights
description: We will be talking to Emmy nominees leading up to the awards show on Sunday. ArtsBeat talked to Raising Hopes Martha Plimpton, a nominee for best supporting actress in a comedy; Michelle Forbes, nominated for best supporting actress in a drama for her role in The Killing; and Beth McCarthy-Miller, nominated for best directing of a comedy for 30 Rock. You can read other interviews here.

title: GT Concept Reflects Kias Upscale Ambitions
description: FRANKFURT  Kia unveiled a radical sedan concept on Tuesday that was almost striking enough to forget that this same company employed hamsters and monsters to sell cars.

title: Inflated Claim? Sensing Something Familiar About the Land Rover DC100s Tires
description: In the spring of 2010, Land Rover invited me to share some ideas for a new version of the brands go-anywhere proto-S.U.V., the Defender. I dutifully sent them a manifesto of crazed demands, and they returned a sketch of a butch little off-roader.

title: Outlaws, Kings and Comedy
description: Dates are subject to change. For more listings: nytimes.com/theater.

title: The New Season: Theater
description: A look at new shows in New York and across the country.

title: Calle 13 Leads the Way in Latin Grammy Nominations
description: Calle 13, the urban duo from Puerto Rico, dominated the list of nominations for the Latin Grammys on Wednesday, named in 10 categories including album of the year and song of the year.

title: On Second Serves, Stosur Was No. 1
description: Samantha Stosurs stunning victory at the 2011 U.S. Open was built around total control in one key area  second serves.

title: Stephen Doyle Assembling "Curiosity"
description: Stephen Doyle assembles one of his tape installations for Paul Toughs cover story in our Education issue.

title: New York Fashion Week Diary | Bruce Pask
description: Ts Bruce Pask interviews Michael Kors before his Spring 2012 show at New York Fashion Week. Kors says that his safari-themed collection was inspired by Peter Beard and Brad and Angie alike, adding, As much as I love New York, the simple truth is we dont have texture around us. We live in cement and concrete.

title: Can Lightning Predict Hurricanes?
description: Radar and satellites can track the path of storms, but Earth Networks, a company that operates networks of environmental sensors, says it can predict their intensity.

title: New York Fashion Diary | Bruce Pask
description: Ts Bruce Pask interviews Michael Kors before his Spring 2012 show at New York Fashion Week.

title: Perry Sees Message in New York; Faults Bachmann HPV Claim
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Gov. Rick Perry of Texas told an audience of more than 1,000 Republican activists here that the results in New York Citys Ninth Congressional District sent signals that President Obama will be a one-term president.

title: Vanguard Aims at Small Companies With Low-Cost 401(k)s
description: Vanguard says it will begin offering low-cost 401(k) packages for smaller companies later this year.

title: Girl, 2, Shot in Head by Stray Bullet on Staten Island
description: A 2-year-old Staten Island girl was struck in the head by a stray bullet from a nearby shooting Wednesday afternoon, the police said.

title: When Contagion Spreads: Crowdsourcing Disease Outbreaks
description: Overview | In this lesson, students consider the movie Contagion in the context of public health and epidemics. They then learn more about the nature of disease outbreaks and experiment with using social media and other digital tools to track and map seasonal flu in their communities.

title: Judge Drops SAC Capital as Defendant in Civil Suit
description: A judge agreed to drop the hedge fund firm SAC Capital as a defendant in a $8 billion civil suit that accused it and other firms of spreading false rumors about Fairfax Financial Holdings to profit from a drop in the insurers share price.

title: R.I.P. Carl Oglesby
description: A few links to stories about Carl Oglesby, the mid-1960s president of the Students for a Democratic Society (SDS), who died yesterday.

title: Solar Is Not Dead, Says Prominent Investor
description: One failed solar company does not mean the entire clean energy industry is doomed.

title: Transatlantic Suitors Wait for Allied Deal to Slip Away
description: Time is running out on Transatlantic Holdings attempt to merge with Allied World Assurance.

title: YouTube Gets New Editing Tools Today
description: Starting today, Googles YouTube users will be able to improve their existing uploads with a new quick-fix Edit Video button. Before, online editing would result in a new video with a new address; now, old uploads can be made new in place.

title: Lil Wayne Sags but Is Still on Top
description: Sales of Lil Waynes new album dropped 77 percent in its second week out but it still easily holds No. 1 on the Billboard chart in a week that also saw the return of the Beatles to the Top 10.

title: Manilla Offers Customers Mobile App and Deal Reminders
description: Technology start-ups want to reinvent everything  the music industry, television and the more mundane tasks in life, like how we pay our bills.

title: Sluggish Start for CWs Ringer
description: The fall TV season is finally upon us, as a handful of premiere episodes faced off against the remaining summer mainstays on Tuesday. An identical twin premise on the CWs Ringer meant a double dose of Sarah Michelle Gellar, but the return of that former vampire slayer to television was mostly met with a ratings shrug. The show averaged 2.7 million total viewers and matched the rating in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic of last seasons Hellcats opener on the CW, which was ultimately canceled. NBC was the No. 1 broadcast network in the 18-to-49 category for the night, helped by the return of Parenthood (6.7 million total viewers) and the final performance episode of Americas Got Talent (13.2 million).

title: Assigning a Jobs Bill as Homework
description: RALEIGH  President Obama turned up the rhetorical heat in his push for his jobs bill on Wednesday, declaring that the country is facing a national emergency that demands Congressional action on his $447 billion economic package.

title: TimesCast | September 14, 2011
description: United States officials try to avert a United Nations vote on a Palestinian state; Elizabeth Warren runs for the Senate; and networks start the fall television season.

title: China Ties Aiding Europe to Its Own Trade Goals
description: BEIJING  If China is going to help ease Europes financial crisis, silken strings could be attached.

title: New Facebook Feature: A Subscription to Friends Feeds
description: If you use Facebook, Im sure you have been faced with this problem: Someone you meet once requests to be your friend on the service, even thoughyou arent really friends.

title: Near Cuernavaca, a Tropical Compound
description: A four-bedroom compound of three houses near Cuernavaca in the Mexican state of Morelos is on the market for $880,000.

title: The Ponzi Thing
description: Well, I gather that a lot of right-wingers are quoting selectively from a piece I wrote 15 years ago in the Boston Review, in which I said that Social Security had a Ponzi game aspect. As always, you should read what I actually wrote. Heres the passage:

title: It Is Necessarily So: Revamped Porgy and Bess Will Come to Broadway
description: A controversial version of Porgy and Bess, the famous 1935 opera, will move to Broadway as planned this winter now that the estates of the operas creators have signed off on the adaptation, its producers announced on Wednesday.

description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Consumers Approved of Many 9/11 Spots
description: As the 10th anniversary of 9/11 neared, numerous advertisers began changing their policy of shying away from participation in events observing the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001. There was speculation that consumers would perceive those changes, and the resulting ads, as tasteless or exploitative.

title: Housing Project Feud Cited in Killing of Basketball Star
description: As soon as Tayshana Murphy, 18, was shot early Sunday in the Grant Houses, a public housing project in Morningside Heights, Manhattan, her friends and neighbors declared that they knew, immediately, who had killed her.

description: It might have been easier if the Justice Departments inspector general, in its recent report, had just said what the Complex Asset Team at the United States Marshals Service was doing right.

title: Newly Released Books
description: One of this months novels has a premise as wonderfully outlandish as any weve seen in a long while. But its not the only book to explore half-hidden communities, whether Jews on the prairie or Mennonites in Mexico. By contrast, a memoirist sticks close to home, describing the physical labor that went into building a cabin by hand in Maine.

title: TimesCast | Warren Enters Senate Race
description: September 14, 2011  Elizabeth Warren, a consumer advocate and Harvard University professor, announces a run for U.S. Senate in Massachusetts.

title: Armed Pirates Hijack a Fuel Tanker Off Benin and Take 23 Crew Members Hostage
description: Armed pirates commandeered a fuel tanker off the West African nation of Benin on Wednesday and took its 23 crew members hostage, an international piracy monitoring group reported.

description: Jack Dumbacher, curator of ornithology and mammalogy at the California Academy of Sciences, writes from Milne Bay, Papua New Guinea, where he is studying island birds and their diseases.

title: Trendspotting: Peplums
description: In a season marked by all manner of flounces and frills, the peplum was a standout.

title: Day 7: Off the Runway
description: Scenes from New York Fashion Week on Sept. 14.

title: Former Harvard President to Head New York Public Library Board
description: Neil L. Rudenstine, the former president of Harvard University, was elected chairman of the board of the New York Public Library on Wednesday. Mr. Rudenstine, 76, is replacing Catherine Marron who has led the board since 2004. He will assume the post immediately.

title: Peplum for the People
description: In a season marked by all manner of flounces and frills, the peplum was a standout. Embraced in the 1940s and 50s by Jacques Fath and Christian Dior, the look, defined by a starchy little overskirt that flares from the waist, reappears every decade or so. It was picked up last season by Marc Jacobs of Louis Vuitton and Christophe Decarnin at Balmain, and revisted once more this week on the runways of Jason Wu, Vera Wang, Badgley Mischka and Rodarte, to name but a handful, lending their collections a shot of vintage Hollywood allure.

title: TimesCast | Fall TV Lineup
description: In their fall TV lineups, networks bet on big budget shows.

title: What You Get for ... $810,000
description: Aberdeen, Wash.

title: Financial Regulators May Get Bigger Budgets
description: Financial regulators clamoring for bigger budgets notched a rare victory on Wednesday, as a Senate subcommittee approved a measure to increase the budgets for cops on the Wall Street beat.

title: For Android Users, a Cure for iTunes Withdrawal
description: A few weeks ago, I pulled off a major feat for a fortysomething relic in the company of a 15-year-old. I taught him something cool about his phone.

title: Simon Cowell vs. Everybody Else
description: Bill Carter and Brian Stelter, reporters on The Timess media desk, take a look at Simon Cowells new talent competition, The X Factor, among other notable new shows arriving this fall.

title: Controls Gone Wild
description: Think your car dashboard has gotten tricked out with digital tools? Think twice, says Consumer Reports in its newest issue, with a bit of a sobering video about the amount of effort drivers must exert to deploy some of the dashboard devices.

title: A Hi-Fi House in Melbourne
description: The exterior of David and Karine ODonnells home in Melbourne, Australia, looks like a striking copy of a vintage hi-fi stereo.

title: In Good Times and Bum Times, a Trouper With Feisty Resolve
description: Had Elaine Stritch sung Im Still Here at Caf Carlyle on Tuesday night, it would have seemed redundant. The mere presence of this lean, glaring lion of a woman in a white shirt and black tights, clenching her fists, said everything about resilience, feisty determination and the will to continue that is voiced in a veteran showgirls embattled proclamation from Follies.

title: Verizons Prepaid Plan Cut By Nearly Half
description: Tomorrow Verizon Mobile will begin to offer a new unlimited prepaid plan at almost half the price of the current plan.

title: Photos of the Moment | Narciso Rodriguez
description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#69", 592, 400, true, chameleonData);Matthew Kristalls New York fashion week photo diary.

title: Sarah Palin Could See This Guy From Her House
description: On May 22, 2010, Joe McGinniss moved into a strategically well-situated house in Wasilla, Alaska. It was next door to the home of former Gov. Sarah Palin and her family, but that understates the highly exploitable proximity of the two places. They were very close together. The Palins could probably hear tweets from the newly hatched birds that Mr. McGinniss excitedly uses as filler for The Rogue, his book about his summer-long experiment in homesteading. The grebe chicks have hatched! he needlessly exclaims.

title: Consortium Views Arts as Engines of Recovery
description: In the two years since he became chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts, Rocco Landesman has been trying to make the case that art is an effective linchpin to economic development. Now in a broad effort to build on that thesis, he has helped to enlist an unusual consortium of foundations, corporations and federal agencies that will use cultural enterprises to anchor and enliven 34 projects around the country, from a struggling city block in Detroit to a vacant school in East Harlem.

title: Madison Avenue Says Ho! Ho! Halloween!
description: For several years, it has been the practice of marketers, retailers and media companies to start making their pitches earlier and earlier for the important Christmas shopping season.

title: A Gentle Nod to Country, With a Streak of Darkness
description: No act in contemporary pop is more careful than the bionic country trio Lady Antebellum, which never leaves a note out of place, which never lets a feeling spill outside the lines. It takes basic components  male-female harmony, sturdy pop arrangements with light brushes of country, an unerring sense of when to shift a song from desperate to redemptive  and arranges them in several different ways, with mostly similar results. These are plain and obvious tricks, shopworn from years of deployment. Lady Antebellum songs dont try to hide anything. Its infuriating.

title: Emotions Swirl Amid the Simple Language
description: Alan Hampton was airing out a new song at the Living Room on Tuesday night, and like the tumblers in a lock, every piece seemed to be clicking into place. Dont you stay mad at me, he sang sweetly, thumb-picking an eight-stringed ukulele. Im doing the best that I can with what Ive got. There was a faint, ambiguous edge to the line, a puckish mix of apology, self-deprecation and passive-aggression. You could picture Mr. Hampton sighing it, rather than singing it, during the deflated last stretch of an exasperating spat.

title: Upheaval in a Family That Hopes to Stand Out
description: Rain clouds flow like lava across the Indonesian countryside at the outset of Position Among the Stars, the final installment in Leonard Retel Helmrichs documentary trilogy about three generations of an upwardly striving family. Later, when clouds of chemicals invade the Jakarta slums to combat dengue fever  a toxic mirror of that dreamy opening shot  their deadly billows encapsulate the films recurring concern: for some, cities can be poison.

title: Its a Close Contest, but One Is Cruder
description: Good news for those who feel as if they hadnt been getting enough vulgarity and misogyny in their television: the next few days bring the return of two of cables raunchiest sitcoms, Its Always Sunny in Philadelphia and Blue Mountain State.

description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#91", 592, 490, true, chameleonData);

title: A Battle at the French Box Office: Two Remakes of One Classic Film
description: PARIS  On screen it is a story of a war between two rival bands of schoolboys. In real life it is a war between two producers, neither of whom will surrender.

title: A Home That Looks Like the Sounds of the 60s
description: MELBOURNE, Australia

title: Teenage Driving Laws May Just Delay Deadly Crashes
description: A nationwide study shows that tougher licensing laws for teenage drivers have reduced deadly accidents among 16-year-olds, but with an unintended consequence: increasing the fatal crash rate among 18-year-olds.

title: Theres an Exciting Clash on the Field. Oh, Thats the Uniform.
description: The right side of the helmet was covered in a black and gold diagonal checkerboard pattern. The left side displayed a red and white cross. The patterns extended from the helmet to the shoulders, and some players accentuated them with similarly styled armbands.

title: The Rogue
description: ONE

title: A Bold and Ferocious Swirl
description: On my first morning in New York, more than 30 years ago, and for most mornings the next three weeks, I stood in line at the New York State Theater to buy, for $2.50, a standing-room spot at the back of the fourth ring to watch New York City Ballet. At some performances we could move down to empty seats, but we could not have afforded them. The performances seen from the fourth ring  including George Balanchines classic Four Temperaments on my very first night  were among the most revelatory of my life. And my younger eyes loved the view from that eyrie.

title: Swan Lake at City Ballet
description: The company opened its season on Tuesday with Peter Martins production of Swan Lake.

title: Tackling Reams of Bank Data Can Take Diligence, and Trust
description: Some people stay sharp in their old age by doing crossword puzzles. Some play memory games or Scrabble or cut back on the heavy drinking.

title: Making the "Grit" Tape Installation
description: The artist Stephen Doyle taped, across multiple surfaces, the words for the traits being taught at KIPP Infinity middle school in Manhattan. Watch the word grit being made.

title: Automakers Resolve to Drop a Few Pounds
description: FRANKFURT

title: Athletes Hit the Front Rows at Fashion Week
description: A NEW face was turning heads at fashion shows this week, and it wasnt Nicki Minaj (the Day-Glo-hued rapper, who sat next to Anna Wintour), Beyonc (sporting a baby bump) or even another basketball all-star.

title: Who Suffered the Most
description: A look at changes in median income before and after the recession for different groups of people.

title: A Bag That Powers Your Gear
description: In these days of always-on devices, theres nothing worse than a dead gadget. New bags by PowerBag promise portable charging for multiple devices on the go.

title: New York Top 5 | J. Crew
description: J. Crew staged its highly anticipated, first-ever New York Fashion Week presentation at the tents in Lincoln Center this season. The mens collection, designed by Frank Muytjens, included some greatest hits of American sportswear (the perfect slender suits and sports jackets, sailor-striped knits and tailored trousers) alongside clever pieces in bright colors, plaids and polka dots, always impeccably styled. The cuffed khakis lined with St. James stripes were absolutely charming, but my favorite look was on the more minimal side. A stone-colored jean jacket, buttoned all the way up and worn with matching jean-style trousers, topped by a navy nylon lightweight parka, was the winner for me. The jacket is from a new capsule collection called Wallace & Barnes that will consist of reinterpretations of favorite vintage pieces that somehow never made it into the main line. Coming soon to a J. Crew near you.

title: French Compositions, and Even a French Horn
description: The New York Chamber Music Festival, during its nine-day run at Symphony Space (which began on Sunday), is offering an eclectic lineup, including anniversary concerts celebrating Mahler, Liszt and the French composer Pierre de Brville; 13 premieres; masterpieces, obscurities, tango and jazz.

title: Susan Orlean on Rin Tin Tin and Her Own Menagerie
description: The New Yorker writer Susan Orleans latest book, Rin Tin Tin: The Life and the Legend, a biography of the famous German shepherd, is a California book in so many ways, she said. In a story that often has the feel of a golden-hued Hollywood dream, the orphaned puppy is found on a French battlefield in World War I and goes on to become a star of silent films, radio and, ultimately, television, in The Adventures of Rin-Tin-Tin.

title: Fashion Weeks Split Personality
description: FOURTEENTH Street was mildly crowded as the couple walked west in the approaching twilight of last Friday. Something about the way they looked suggested that they were headed to Milk Studios, the fashion show site on West 15th Street, and that it might be interesting to follow them.

title: Live and Let Dance
description: Paul McCartney collaborated with Peter Martins, the New York City Ballets ballet master in chief, for Oceans Kingdom, which has its gala opening next week at Lincoln Center.

title: Suspended Animation
description: MOSS & LAM, a Toronto art studio, specializes in large-scale installations and creative wall finishes  what amounts to special effects for interiors and architectural projects.

title: Hanging Mobiles
description: The Toronto artists Deborah Moss and Edward Lam shopped for mobiles that bring beauty and action to a room.

title: Facebooks New Friend-Sorting Features
description: This week, Facebook is rolling out two new features designed to make it easier to share posts with small groups of people who belong to the same family, city, workplace or school as you, and to separate your best friends from your so-so friends.

title: Cathy Horyn's Spring 2012 Report
description: Cathy Horyn discusses themes that have emerged during New York Fashion Week so far.

title: McGinniss Book on Palin Comes Out
description: Just as Palinologists and politicos are awaiting Sarah Palins imminent (or so she says) decision on whether she will run for president, a new biography of her makes lurid accusations that have filtered out to media outlets now that the book has begun circulating.

title: Back to School, Demurely
description: ITS all about grandma chic, said Chelsea Roberts, who was surveying the clothes in SoHo one Thursday last month while back-to-school shopping. Ms. Roberts, 17, is about to begin her senior year at Roland Park Country School in Baltimore.

title: Battle for Libya | September 14, 2011
description: Demonstrators protested the prospect of Islamists taking over the revolution in Libya while Qaddafi loyalists remained in Bani Walid and Surt.

title: A Big Player Puts a Toe in the Pond
description: DOES New York need a Nordstrom? Weve got our big Bs: Barneys, Bloomies, Bergdorf and the sadly diminished Bendel (R.I.P. Bonwit Teller and your violet-festooned shopping bags). Also our profusion of little bs (boutiques) offering every brand that this Seattle-based department store chain carries, and then some. And yet Nordstrom continues to make advances: slowly, cautiously, like a love-handled suitor not quite sure his embrace will be welcome.

title: Do Individual Acts Help Save the Planet?
description: To the Editor:

title: Some Democrats Are Balking at Obamas Jobs Bill
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama anticipated Republican resistance to his jobs program, but he is now meeting increasing pushback from his own party. Many Congressional Democrats, smarting from the fallout over the 2009 stimulus bill, say there is little chance they will be able to support the bill as a single entity, citing an array of elements they cannot abide.

title: An interview with Julie Newmar; digital comics; animated GIFs; tech news.
description: The actress and dancer Julie Newmar discusses her new book, perpetual Internet fandom and her approach to playing an android on TV. George Gene Gustines and Adam W. Kepler of The Times offer pros and cons for reading comic books on digital devices  or sticking to good old-fashioned ink and paper. Pedro Rafael Rosado offers a how-to lesson on making your own animated GIFs. The weeks tech news includes Microsofts developers preview of Windows 8, GameStops venture into making its own gaming tablet, and new surveys on both Android adoption in Europe and Americans use of social networks. The Tip of the Week highlights a quick way to edit photos right on the Flickr site.

title: A Political Upset in New York
description: To the Editor:

title: Seeking Relief Through Arnica
description: BEFORE the C.F.D.A. Fashion Awards in June, the New York-based fashion designer Phillip Lim, whod been traveling frequently and working hard, was feeling a bit puffy. I heard of models and other designers taking arnica before big events or photo shoots, so I thought Id try it out, he said recently, referring to the homeopathic supplement arnica montana. Its supposed to slim you down because it flushes you out. And it clears up your skin.

title: Palestinians Say a U.N. Gamble on Statehood Is Worth the Risks
description: KALANDIA, West Bank  It is far from clear what will happen when the Palestinians go to the United Nations next week to seek recognition of statehood. But the initiative is engaging a Palestinian public that had become deeply cynical after 20 years of intermittent Israeli-Palestinian peace talks.

title: History May Point Toward More Conservative G.O.P. Nominee
description: The Republican presidential nomination is shaping up to be a battle between the partys moderate and conservative factions, as Jeff Zeleny and Michael Shear reported Tuesday:

title: TimesCast | Palestinian Statehood
description: September 14, 2011  U.S. officials make a last minute effort to avert a United Nations vote on Palestinian statehood.

title: Six Actresses Not in Search of TV Work
description: BURBANK, Calif.

title: Head of Goldmans Computer-Trading Shop to Step Down
description: Katinka Domotorffy, the head of Goldman Sachss quantitative investment strategies group, will retire from the firm at the end of the year, according to a letter the banks asset management division sent to investors on Wednesday.

title: Wait, Wait, I Think She Changed
description: THE e-mails started coming in June, as many as four a day, announcing what Rosie Huntington-Whiteley wore. It was a Ferragamo dress at a photo call in Rio de Janeiro, a Vhernier ring in Moscow, a Stella McCartney dress in Berlin.

title: New Bedding From Area
description: For some time now, the dark-to-light gradation of color known as ombr has been a trend in fashion and hair, and recently, its made an appearance in home furnishings as well. At the New York International Gift Fair last month, Area introduced a collection of bed linens called Ines that looked like ombr. But Anki Spets, the companys owner and designer, insisted that it is technically a gradient stripe.

title: Tech Talk Podcast: Catwoman and an Animated Internet
description: Julie Newmar has appeared on many TV shows that entranced young baby boomers  Star Trek, The Twilight Zone, Get Smart and Batman, in which she was Catwoman. One of her earliest roles was playing an android on the 1964 science-fiction sit-com My Living Doll. Miss Newmar discusses her new book The Conscious Catwoman Explains Life on Earth and reflects on her career and her continued fame on the Internet.

title: The Food Was Great, the Groveling Wasnt
description: LAST year, when my girlfriend accepted a job in Mumbai, we had to find an apartment on short notice, a daunting task in that citys drastically oversubscribed housing market. But we were lucky, finding a cheap sublet at one of the citys most desirable addresses, in the Churchgate neighborhood of south Mumbais Art Deco precinct. The spacious three-bedroom apartment overlooked one of the rare open spaces in the city, the Oval Maidan, an oblong park where dozens of cricket matches intertwine each evening, and beyond which sit the august Gothic buildings of the British period.

title: Dyson Hot, a Fan That Heats and Cools
description: If you like the looks of the Dyson Tower Fan, you will be pleased to learn of the Dyson Hot, a strikingly similar heater that hits the market today. With a remote-control thermostat that can be set between 32 and 99 degrees, the Dyson Hot, which sells for about $400, can do double duty as a cooling fan.

title: A Pop-Up Shop Previews a Cecil Beaton Show
description: In anticipation of Cecil Beaton: The New York Years, a show opening next month at the Museum of the City of New York, the New York Design Center and 1stdibs will host a pop-up preview, Cecil Beaton and the 1930s, on the centers 10th floor, starting on Friday.

title: 300 Years of Glassware at Jasper Morrison
description: For the last two years, the Jasper Morrison shop in London has presented exhibitions coinciding with the London Design Festival that have focused on the design of a specific object: the first year, Jugs, Jars and Pitchers; the second, Trays From Around the World.

title: Sales at George Smith and Others
description: Floor models, prototypes and in-stock furnishings are up to 70 percent off during the annual sample sale at Desiron, through Sept. 25 (the Bedford Club Chair, originally $4,015, is $1,205; the Chrysler Cocktail Table, regularly $5,600, is $2,800); 151 Wooster Street (Houston Street); (212) 353-2600 or desiron.com.

title: A Texas Sanctuary for Waterlilies
description: Ken Landon, a renowned waterlily hybridizer and plant explorer, has assembled a collection in San Angelo, Tex., that contains 90 percent of the worlds known wild species of waterlilies and more than 4,000 hybrids.

title: Lights Out, Game On
description: LAST night I slept on athletic shorts. Or more accurately, I slept on the stuff athletic shorts are made of: high-tech performance fabric, the sort of super-Lycra that goes into the uniforms of, say, basketball players.

title: For Waterlilies, an Odd Refuge in Texas
description: SAN ANGELO, Tex.

title: Pay for Only 4 Years of College. Guaranteed.
description: ASHLAND, Va.  Each incoming freshman at Randolph-Macon College this year was eligible to take part in a brief signing ceremony.

title: Beauty Spots
description: LET THEM SMELL GREAT  When Marie Antoinette was sent to prison during the French Revolution, she took with her a dark jade flask containing a floral scent that apparently reminded her of her gardens at Versailles. Right before she was executed, the story goes, she entrusted the flask to her loyal friend, Madame de Tourzel, whose descendants still have it. Lubin Paris is resurrecting the scent with Black Jade: a mix of rose, jasmine and bergamot, with hints of cardamom and cinnamon (from $130, at Henri Bendel in New York and Luckyscent.com).

title: A Flowering of a Family Legacy
description: DIAMONDS glinted like tiny asteroids on Tatiana Von Furstenbergs fingers, every one of them a talisman of sorts. There was the domelike gem she inherited from her father, the faceted stone that was a gift from her former husband and another that belonged to her maternal grandmother.

title: The A.M.A., on Doctor Fees
description: To the Editor:

title: Lauding Columbias Leader
description: To the Editor:

title: Chinese Team Takes Top Prize at a Tournament in Beijing
description: The Hua Yuan Cup world womens elite tournament was held in Beijing from Sept. 5 to 9 with total prize money of $200,000. Eight teams were invited: Canada, England, France, the Netherlands, Sweden, the United States and two from China.

title: Vaughn and Carson Help Give the Liberty a Shot
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The five-on-five session was playing out on the Madison Square Garden Training Center court, a rehearsal before the W.N.B.A. playoffs for Kia Vaughn, working up a sweat in the low post, and Essence Carson, showing off her energy a bit farther from the basket.

title: Trendspotting at TechCrunch Disrupt
description: Entrepreneurial zeal is the inevitable theme at technology conferences like TechCrunch Disrupt, which ends its three-day run in San Francisco on Wednesday. Start-up founders and those who wanted to be overdosed on self-promotion, salesmanship and name-dropping while Silicon Valley celebrities pontificated on stage.

title: To Wit and Long Memories, Anna Sui
description: Anna Sui rarely fails to put a smile on your face with her whimsical prints and girly dresses, and her show Wednesday night was no exception. Her soundtrack transformed the big tent at Lincoln Center into a scene from Club Sept in Paris in the 1970s, and the models lined up at the back of the runway as if they were waiting to get in. One by one, they took the catwalk wearing chiffon trousers and tops in dark vintage prints, many of them with matching turbans, or long lace gowns with floppy hats. Her prints were especially witty, one with stripes that, if you looked closely, were made of toothbrushes.

title: Beyond New Atheism
description: The Stone is featuring occasional posts by Gary Gutting, a professor of philosophy at the University of Notre Dame, that apply critical thinking to information and events that have appeared in the news.

title: NoBar
description: WITH its reclaimed church pews and Edison bulbs, NoBar aims to be something that this strip of fried-chicken outlets and dollar stores in Bedford-Stuyvesant lacks: a stylish but unpretentious bar.

title: Minority Groups and Gay Marriage
description: To the Editor:

title: Near the 5-Inch Heels, Guerrillas on Four Wheels
description: EVERYONE was expecting New York Fashion Week to embrace mobile this fall. They just didnt mean vehicles.

title: The Buzz
description: A PREVIEW of the must-attend parties, talked-about openings and fashionable night spots for the week ahead.

title: Rick Perry Tackles Faith  and Bad Grades
description: Speaking at Liberty University in Lynchburg, Va., the candidate for the Republican presidential nomination told students about his poor college performance, but spoke little about politics.

title: Bloggingheads: Is Perry Lying?
description: David Corn, left, of Mother Jones and James Pinkerton of Fox News debate Rick Perry's claims about Obama's record.

title: As Fighting in Kabul Wanes, Sniping on Twitter Begins
description: As the firefight in Kabul, Afghanistan, simmered down early on Wednesday, the battle on Twitter began heating up, with representatives of the NATO-led coalition and the Taliban trading barbs in a burst of virtual conversation.

title: Win May Not Be Needed to Take the FedEx Cup
description: LEMONT, Ill.  With the PGA Tours playoffs for the FedEx Cup coming down to the final two weeks, some startling possibilities could emerge from the field of 70 that begins play Thursday at the BMW Championship at Cog Hill Golf and Country Club.

title: Barely Time for the Shows
description: FASHION insiders were exhausted before the shows even started. The twice-a-year bacchanal known as New York Fashion Week started two days early this year, with a flurry of parties for models (One Management), store openings (Surface to Air) and birthdays (Rachel Zoe).

title: House Is Expected to Pass Bill Aiding New Boeing Plant
description: Leading House Republicans on Thursday will take up the contentious debate over the National Labor Relations Boards efforts to block Boeing from operating a $750 million aircraft assembly line in South Carolina instead of Washington State.

title: After a Long March, Chinese Surrender to Capitalist Shrines
description: PARIS  It was once the Americans, then the Japanese, then the Russians. Now its the Chinese.

title: Ready for Next Round, Sanchez Bounces Up Off the Canvas
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Mark Sanchez spent Monday being tested for a concussion, resting, sitting in a cold tub and getting a massage. He said the pummeling he received Sunday at the hands of the Dallas Cowboys was really not a big deal.

title: AOL, Yahoo and Microsoft Reportedly in Ad Deal
description: Yahoo, AOL and Microsoft, three major technology companies that have traditionally competed for digital advertising revenue, have created an unusual partnership in which they will sell ads for one another.

title: Steps Can Be Painful as Giants Line Masters a Difficult Dance
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Offensive linemen are the Goliaths of the N.F.L., and for most fans they are probably interchangeable. One 300-pounder gets injured? Just get another. Any ogre will do.

title: Three Terrorist Groups in Africa Pose Threat to U.S., American Commander Says
description: WASHINGTON  The senior American military commander for Africa warned Wednesday that three violent extremist organizations on the continent were trying to forge an alliance to coordinate attacks on the United States and Western interests.

title: Vice Media to Expand Offerings of Video Entertainment on Its Site
description: Vice Media, a company that produces things like documentary films profiling Liberian war lords and albums by the Black Lips, has decided to go old-school media.

title: Arthur Evans, Leader in Gay Rights Fight, Dies at 68
description: Arthur Evans, who helped form and lead the movement that coalesced after gay people and their supporters protested a 1969 police raid on the Stonewall Inn, a Greenwich Village gay bar, died on Sunday at his home in San Francisco. He was 68.

title: Syrian TV Station Accuses Al Jazeera of Fabricating Uprising
description: A YouTube channel called the Syrian Interpreter has posted a subtitled recording of the Syrian television station Addounia TV claiming in a Sept. 9 broadcast that the news station Al Jazeera has built enormous cinematic replicas of Syrian cities and squares in the Gulf state of Qatar in order to fabricate the uprising in Syria.

title: Yanks Closer Also Serves as Mentor and Counselor
description: SEATTLE  One afternoon earlier this season, when Alex Rodriguez was searching for his swing, Mariano Rivera took him into the trainers room for a quiet but emphatic conversation.

title: A City of Glass Towers, and a Hazard for Migratory Birds
description: Most bird-watching enthusiasts spend their days looking up in the hope of seeing the flash of a yellow warbler or a scarlet tanager. Deborah A. Laurel looks at the ground.

title: Showing Their Colors
description: College football teams across the country are wearing new, and sometimes garish, uniforms to increase the visibility of both the university and the apparel manufacturer.

title: Ex-Spy Chief of Colombia Is Sentenced to Prison
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Jorge Noguera, Colombias former spymaster, was convicted on Wednesday of collaborating with paramilitary assassination squads and sentenced to 25 years in prison for his involvement in the 2004 murder of a prominent sociologist.

title: Mog, the Music Streaming Service, Will Offer a Free Version
description: Music, it seems, wants to be free.

title: Lottery Numbers
Forecast Comes True: No Playoffs for the Mets
description: Minutes after being formally eliminated from playoff contention on Wednesday afternoon, the Mets did their best to escape the present and dwell on the past.

title: Manufacturing Expectations and Belief at Mississippi State
description: STARKVILLE, Miss.  The president of Mississippi State, Mark E. Keenum, canceled Thursdays classes months ago in anticipation of a night game against No. 3 Louisiana State. Early Wednesday morning, fans began lining a grassy area known as the Junction, waiting for a chapel bell to ring at 5 p.m. so they could officially begin tailgating more than 24 hours before kickoff. Before the game, and not far from the all-day revelry, construction workers will break ground on a $25 million football training facility.

title: Judge Says Hedge Funds May Have Used Inside Information
description: There have long been whispers on Wall Street that hedge funds have hijacked the bankruptcy process, using their influence as debt holders to obtain and trade on insider information about when and how a company will restructure.

title: After Choosing a Candidate Who Lost, a Democrat Stands in an Unfavorable Light
description: New York Democrats woke up on Wednesday morning to an unwelcome new reality  the voters of Queens and Brooklyn had elected a Republican to represent the Ninth Congressional District  and an uncomfortable new question: What went wrong?

title: Frank Quattrones Golden Touch
description: When Frank Quattrone comes calling, buyers should beware. The latest coup for the former Credit Suisse First Boston ace is persuading Google to bid against itself for Motorola Mobility. Since starting Qatalyst Partners, his boutique investment bank, Mr. Quattrone has extracted a much higher premium for clients than rival tech bankers. Silicon Valley has now been given fair warning.

title: Bradley to Coach Egypt
description: Bob Bradley, the former coach of the United States national team, who was fired over the summer and replaced by Jurgen Klinsmann, will become the next coach of Egypt, said a spokesman for Egypts federation.

title: Islamists Growing Sway Raises Questions for Libya
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  In the emerging post-Qaddafi Libya, the most influential politician may well be Ali Sallabi, who has no formal title but commands broad respect as an Islamic scholar and populist orator who was instrumental in leading the mass uprising.

title: Walking Out on China
description: YUNNAN PROVINCE, in southwestern China, has long been the exit point for Chinese who yearn for a new life outside the country. There, one can sneak out of China by land, passing through pristine forests, or one can go by water, floating all the way down the Lancang River until it becomes the Mekong, which meanders into Myanmar, Laos, Thailand, Cambodia and Vietnam.

title: Just Elected to Congress, and Already Talking of Staying
description: Bob Turner, who won a special election on Tuesday to succeed Anthony D. Weiner in Congress, emerged onto his porch in Rockaway Point, Queens, at 9:45 on Wednesday morning in a polo shirt and shorts and bare feet, still groggy from his victory party the night before.

title: Poor Models. Seriously.
description: Boston

title: G.O.P. Sees Bellwether in Two Democratic Defeats
description: WASHINGTON  The Republican Party on Wednesday seized on the outcome of two special Congressional elections as fresh evidence that voters are souring on President Obama and are prepared to hold Democrats accountable for the rising level of voter dissatisfaction over the direction of the country.

title: Seeing Ripple in Jewish Vote
description: WASHINGTON  Not since Jimmy Carter in 1980 has a Democrat running for president failed to win a lopsided majority of the Jewish vote. This has been true during times of peace or war, and even when there has been deep acrimony between the White House and the Israeli government.

title: Thursday: Speedy Delivery
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Today marks a two-day streak, if you can have one of those, of Seattle constructors. Yesterday, we had Jeff Chens animated SPY VS. SPY puzzle. Today, Samuel A. Donaldson is back and he is building HOUSEs all over our puzzle.

title: The Bachmann Chronicles
description: Lets talk about Michele Bachmann.

title: French and British Leaders to Visit Libya
description: President Nicolas Sarkozy of France will travel with the British prime minister, David Cameron, on Thursday to Libya, where they are credited with a diplomatic and military triumph in providing European leadership to defend the Libyan opposition and help overthrow Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, Libyan officials said.

title: A Kenyan Familys Journey Out of Poverty
description: A microfinance organization helped a woman move to a safer home and run a successful sewing business.

title: Sewing Her Way Out of Poverty
description: NAIROBI, Kenya

title: Automakers and U.A.W. Still Talking
description: DETROIT  The United Automobile Workers agreed early on Thursday to extend contracts with General Motors and Chrysler after the parties were unable to reach new deals by the time the old pacts expired at midnight.

title: New Center Fielder for Yankees?
description: SEATTLE  Mariano Rivera has done many things in baseball, from recording 600 saves to starting games and even batting. But he has never played center field.

title: Israel and New Yorks Ninth District
description: There has already been a lot of theorizing about why a little-known Republican businessman, Bob Turner, won Tuesdays special Congressional election in a traditionally Democratic New York City district. The grim economy appears to have been a big factor in his victory over Assemblyman David Weprin, and some voters also complained about Mr. Weprins principled vote in Albany to legalize gay marriage, which was anathema to many ultra-Orthodox Jewish voters.

title: Can Old Dresses Help a Kenyan Dressmaker?
description: My Thursday column tells the story of Jane Ngoiri, a woman in Nairobi who has managed to transform her life  and her childrens  with some outside help. Originally, I thought I would write this column about microfinance, but as I followed Jane it became increasingly obvious that while her access to credit helped her start a business, the biggest help was the psychological push to save and start thinking about the future.

title: Unconstitutional Policing
description: The Justice Department has issued a devastating report on the rampant corruption and constitutional violations committed by the Puerto Rico Police Department, the second-largest police force in the United States. It concluded that lasting reform will require nothing less than federal judicial intervention. And the sooner, the better.

title: Bleak News on Health Insurance
description: Nearly one million more Americans went without health insurance in 2010 than in 2009. This distressing news is further evidence of the need for government safety net programs and the national health care reforms that will take effect mostly in 2014.

title: Groupon Back on Track for Its I.P.O.
description: Groupon is planning to put its initial public offering back on track even as markets remain rocky.

title: In India, Online Retailers Take a New Tack
description: BANGALORE, India  Several months ago, when Prabhu Kumar could not find a book he wanted in bookstores here, he found it online at Amazon.com for $10. But he had to pay more than $9 in fees to have Amazon ship it to him.

title: Help Needed for Student Debtors
description: New federal data showing a spike in student loan defaults does not simply reflect the bad economy, although that is a factor. A substantial part of the problem also lies in the fast-growing for-profit college industry, which accounts for only about 10 percent of students but nearly half of student loan defaults.

title: A Riders Guide to the Public Bicycles
description: Answers to common questions about the citys bike-share program:

title: Ex-Senators Chief of Staff Is Expected to Plead Guilty
description: The man who served as chief of staff to former State Senator Vincent L. Leibell III, who was sentenced to 21 months in prison on federal corruption charges this year, is expected to plead guilty to obstruction of justice on Thursday in federal court in White Plains, the mans lawyer said.

title: Charlies Angels Didnt Look So Sexy Without Some Help
description: I LOVE wearing other peoples clothes. Hand-me-downs, vintage, loaners, whatever. I like clothes with a provenance, a history. Somehow I imagine that I can feel the traces of another persons energy lingering in the threads.

title: Signs of Faux Foul Play in Russian Politics
description: MOSCOW  In a Russian political campaigning season known for monochrome and monotony, a spectacle of sorts unfolded Wednesday when the businessman Mikhail D. Prokhorov announced a scramble to stop what he called a Kremlin-orchestrated takeover of his party.

title: Shopping Snapshots: Sept. 15
description: What Brooklyn Decker is wearing now; a Danish designer comes up with a series of fragrances meant to evoke major cities; and other items.

title: Scouting Report
description: LIMITED EDITIONS

title: Vatican Gives Group Reconciliation Path
description: The Vatican on Wednesday told a breakaway traditionalist group with which Pope Benedict XVI has taken pains to reconcile that it must accept certain church teachings before being fully brought back into the Roman Catholic Church. The Vaticans chief doctrinal officer, Cardinal William J. Levada, met with Bishop Bernard Fellay of the Society of St. Pius X, which split with Rome to protest the liberalizing reforms of the Second Vatican Council. In 1988, Pope John Paul II excommunicated the group's founder, Archbishop Marcel Lefebvre, as well as four bishops he consecrated without the approval of the Vatican, including Bishop Fellay. In 2009, Benedict lifted the excommunications of the four bishops, even though one of them, Richard Williamson, had denied the scope of the Holocaust.

title: Backpacks: Civilizing The Pack Mentality
description: Its been to Katmandu. Now its settled down and has a job.

title: Scientists With Different Politics Speak With One Voice on Climate
description: I encourage you to read a Miami Herald Op-Ed article written by Kerry Emanuel, a veteran climate and hurricane researcher at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and Peter C. Frumhoff, an ecologist who directs science and policy for the Union of Concerned Scientists.

title: Civilizing the Pack Mentality
description: TEES have done it. Jeans have done it. And, of course, a zillion teens have done it.

title: N.B.A. Players Union May Have Another Battle: With Player Agents
description: LAS VEGAS  The leadership of the N.B.A. players union touched down at McCarran International Airport on Wednesday, with one tense meeting behind them and the prospect of another on the horizon.

title: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Today
description: The police charged (Indian Express) two high school students with criminal conspiracy in connection with the bombing of the Delhi High Court last week, the first criminal charges to be filed in the blast, which killed 12 people and injured dozens more. The police say the young men had sent an e-mail claiming that the militant group Harkat-ul-Jihad Islami was responsible for the attack.

title: Just Tossing Around the Old Bag of Corn
description: PARISIANS have ptanque. London society has croquet. And though New Yorkers have dallied with both, many have now discovered a lawn game from the flyover states.

title: Anatomy of a Rebuke
description: How the Republican, Bob Turner, won in Anthony D. Weiners old district.

title: Looking Toward Print for a List That Lures
description: IF you are Nine West, a mainstream shoe and accessories company with mall stores in places like Monroe, Ohio; and McAllen, Tex.; staging a party for a new line during New York Fashion Week can be something of a challenge.

title: Crowning Achievements
description: STEPHEN JONES is as close to a rock star as a milliner can be. In addition to designing his own marvelous hats, he has provided headgear to a bunch of designers: Marc Jacobs, Rei Kawakubo, LWren Scott. When asked to organize a hat exhibition at the Victoria & Albert Museum in London, from its archives, even Mr. Jones was a little awed. There were 4,000 hats in the drawers, he said.

title: Joint Commission Report on Quality and Safety
description: The Joint Commission, the countrys leading accrediting body for hospitals, released a list on Tuesday of 405 medical centers that are most diligent in following standard protocols.

title: Report Finds Improved Performance by Hospitals
description: In the latest advance for health care accountability, the countrys leading hospital accreditation board, the Joint Commission, released a list on Tuesday of 405 medical centers that have been the most diligent in following protocols to treat conditions like heart attack and pneumonia. Almost without exception, most highly regarded hospitals in the United States, from Johns Hopkins in Baltimore to the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn., did not make the list.

title: The Bulgogi Slider Is a Delicious Curveball
description: There are three ways to make the recipe that follows here; three pathways to dinnertime nirvana. The dish is the Korean barbecue standard known as bulgogi  fire meat, is the literal translation  transformed into a sandwich filling, a sloppy Joe for a more perfect union. (File under Blessings of Liberty.) Fed to children with a tall glass of milk, the sandwiches may inspire smiles and licked plates, rapt attention and the request that the meal be served at least monthly  they are not at all too spicy for younger palates. Given to adults accompanied by cold lager, cucumber kimchi and a pot of the fermented Korean hot-pepper paste known as gochujang, they can rise to higher planes.

title: Parents Still Struggle With Proper Child-Seat Use, Study Finds
description: With National Child Passenger Safety Week approaching, the nonprofit organization Safe Kids USA released on Thursday new research relating to the use of child safety seats.

title: Sharing the Stresses of Being a Doctor
description: One afternoon, a doctor friend whose clinical skills and bedside manner Ive long admired called wanting desperately to talk about her day. Exasperated, and feeling as if she had no one to turn to at work, she reached out to me, her friend.

title: Poor Are Still Getting Poorer, but Downturns Punch Varies, Census Data Show
description: WASHINGTON  The discouraging numbers spilling from the Census Bureaus poverty report this week were a disquieting reminder that a weak economy continues to spread broad and deep pain.

title: Music to Strut the Collection By
description: IF the clothes are the meat of the show, music is the soul that brings it alive, said Prabal Gurung, the fashion designer. Each season we want to tell a story for 12 minutes or so on the runway. That story can be successfully told when there is a perfect harmony between the clothes and the music.

title: Average Scores Slip on SAT
description: Average scores on the SAT fell across the nation this year, with the reading score for the high school class of 2011 falling three points to 497, the lowest on record, according to a report Wednesday by the College Board, which administers the exams.

title: For Hikers Imprisoned in Iran, an Expansive Online Campaign
description: In advance of his yearly United Nations visit and media blitz, Irans president, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, announced that two American hikers imprisoned in Iran since 2009 and sentenced to eight years for espionage, would be released imminently, my colleagues Alan Cowell and Rick Gladstone reported. But a day later, as David D. Kirkpatrick reported, Iranian courts rebuked Mr. Ahmadinejad, saying he did not have the authority to free the prisoners.

title: Bringing the Hot Springs Home
description: A California artist turned his desert property into an art studio, vacation home and mineral spa.

title: Turkey: New Site for Missile Shield Plan
description: Turkey will locate an early-warning radar system, part of a new NATO shield against a missile attack in Europe, at a military base in the southeast, a Foreign Ministry spokesman said. The base lies about 375 miles west of Turkeys border with Iran; American and NATO military officials have said the missile shield plan was designed to deter Iran. Iran has already expressed its opposition to Turkeys decision to join the system.

title: Yankees Fall to Mariners in 12th, Keeping Rivera From No. 601
description: SEATTLE  Having won the first two games of the series here, and with a healthy lead over the Boston Red Sox in the division, the Yankees could afford to go without the sweep. But if they had managed just one or two more hits, they probably would have had it.

title: Sept. 15, 1963 | Birmingham Church Is Bombed by Klansmen
description: On Sept. 15, 1963, a bomb exploded before a Sunday morning sermon in the predominantly black 16th Street Baptist Church in Birmingham, Ala., killing four girls and injuring more than 20 others. The bombing incited violence in the city, which led to the killing of two black boys, one by a police officer.

title: UBS Blames $2 Billion Loss on Rogue Trader
description: UBS said on Thursday that a rogue trader in its investment bank had lost $2 billion, delivering a fresh blow to the beleaguered Swiss bank.

He is also a principal in Salute Capital Management Ltd. Simon Johnson, the former chief economist at the International Monetary Fund, is the co-author of 13 Bankers.

title: How Dick Cheney Reined in Presidential Power
description: On March 10, 2004, at the end of a stressful day running the Justice Departments Office of Legal Counsel, I received an urgent message from the deputy attorney general, James Comey. He wanted me to hurry to George Washington University Hospital, where Attorney General John Ashcroft was recovering from gallbladder surgery. The reason: the White House chief of staff, Andrew Card, and the presidents lawyer, Alberto Gonzales, were on their way to visit.

title: If You Drink or Use Drugs, Do Your Parents Know?
description: A new poll shows that only 10 percent of parents think their teenage children have used alcohol in the past year. Yet in a different poll, 52 percent of teenagers said they drank. Do your parents know  or suspect  the true level of yours and friends drug or alcohol use? Or are they blind to the truth?

title: Cameron of Britain and Sarkozy of France Visit Libya
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  The leaders of Britain and France visited Libya on Thursday in a triumphal but heavily guarded tour intended to boost the countrys revolutionary leaders, whose forces were propelled to power with NATOs help last month by routing Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi and his military in the most violent conflict of the Arab Spring uprisings.

title: Part 4: Answers to Your Back-to-School Admissions Questions

title: Tip of the Week: Basic Photo Editing on Flickr
description: If the photos you post to your Flickr account still have room for improvement, you can perform basic image-editing chores like cropping and adjusting exposure right on the site. To edit a photo you have uploaded to Flickr, click its thumbnail on your photostream page. When the picture appears on its own page, click the Actions menu in the upper left corner and choose Edit photo in Picnik.

title: Monitoring the Perils of Poor Scheduling in the N.F.L.
description: By any measure, Oaklands Hue Jackson got what he wanted in his debut as an N.F.L. head coach on Monday night. The Raiders went to Denver and won against a division opponent. They dominated the Broncos physically, and Denver fans were left calling for the backup quarterback Tim Tebow.

title: Fishonomics: How We Did This Summer
description: Let us now praise money. Id sooner talk religion or politics or New York center fielders, past and present, but we have just finished the high season in the Hamptons and I have money on the mind and money on the table, and some dear readers think that divulging hard numbers will somehow help owners of florist shops in Tallahassee and microbreweries in Oshkosh.

title: Present Tents
description: So long, tepee. The next level of glamping is the architent  high-spec, high-style canvas accommodations.

title: The U.N. Is Open; Mark Your Dance Card
description: So the United Nations General Assembly opened on Wednesday. You probably knew that. City Room did, too.

title: When Its Time to Hit the Road
description: Sometimes you travel because you want to, sometimes because you need to. Whatever the reason, planning a trip can be logistical nightmare for caregivers. But there are ways to smooth the journey, experts say.

title: Unfurling a Life of Creative Exuberance
description: The Museum of Modern Art has never known quite what to do with Willem de Kooning. You can package Jackson Pollock as drips and Barnett Newman as zips, but de Kooning, who painted both opulent abstractions and big, blowsy dames, resists easy branding. So, apart from a show of late work in 1997, the museum has neglected him, until now.

title: Metallica Earns Its Top Billing of the Big Four
description: The concert, or the tour, or the notion, is called the Big Four, and it needs an asterisk. Long ago one of the four became much bigger than the rest.

title: Modi: Metamorphosis or Albatross?
description: For its most recent front cover, Society magazine, an Indian monthly dedicated to lifestyles of the rich and well-connected, made an unexpected choice  Gujarats chief minister, Narendra Modi, arguably Indias most controversial major political figure.

title: An Education
description: Three American siblings attend an experimental school in Moscow where instruction is only in Russian and classes are videotaped to improve teaching.

title: My Familys Experiment in Extreme Schooling
description: The phone rang, and my stomach clenched when I heard her voice. Daddy? I want to go home, said my 8-year-old daughter, Arden. Two hours earlier, I dropped Arden and her two siblings off at their new school in a squat building in a forest of Soviet-era apartment blocks on Krasnoarmeyskaya (Red Army) Street in Moscow. They hugged me goodbye, clinging a little too long, and as I rode the metro to my office, I said a kind of silent prayer to myself that they would get through the day without falling apart.

title: Executives May Be Too Confident on Cybersecurity, Survey Finds
description: Every week comes a new report warning how vulnerable consumers, companies and government agencies are to hackers bent on breaching computer systems and extracting sensitive data.

title: Facing Fall | The Cherry-Stained Lip
description: The makeup artist Tina Turnbow gives us the lowdown on her starring makeup looks for fall.

title: New Layers Amid the Song and Dance
description: THE theater director Michael Mayer faced deep skepticism in 1997 when he first proposed a radical plan to the literary executors for On a Clear Day You Can See Forever, a 1965 musical admired for its lush score but undercut by loopy story lines about ESP and reincarnation. Mr. Mayer wanted to rewrite the book and to transform its muddled romantic subplot into a love triangle full of dramatic and comic tension. His boldest idea: turning one of the central characters, a flighty woman named Daisy, into a gay florist named David. The gender switch was meant to throw impediments into the main narrative, about a male psychiatrist who hypnotizes Daisy/David and then falls in love with her/his past self, a woman named Melinda Wells.

title: China Sentences Four Uighurs to Death Over Unrest

title: 5 Central Banks Move to Supply Cash to Europe
description: FRANKFURT  Worried that Europes debt impasse posed a growing threat to the global financial system, the worlds major central banks moved Thursday to assure that European banks would not run short of cash as troubled nations like Greece and Italy sought to stabilize their economies.

title: Billionaire Condemns Party He Led as a Kremlin Puppet
description: MOSCOW  It has been a long time since a Russian billionaire attacked the political system. In the past, it has not ended well.
