title: Obama Praises Libyas Post-Qaddafi Leaders at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS  President Obama on Tuesday extended to Libyas transitional leader a diplomatic honor never offered his predecessor, meeting formally with Mustafa Abdel-Jalil at the United Nations and heralding the victory of Libyan rebels who brought an end to the 42-year reign of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: Survivor in Connecticut Familys Murder Again Recalls an Ordinary Sunday
description: NEW HAVEN  Again, the sole survivor of the Cheshire, Conn., home invasion four years ago told a rapt jury about the last hours of his wife and daughters.

title: Growing Pains in Maturing Brains and Global Networks
description: David Dobbs cover story in the October issue of National Geographic is a fascinating exploration of the science illuminating how the brains neuronal wiring evolves as adolescence crests. The reboot turns a primal teen (the title of a marvelous book by my colleague Barbara Strauch) into a more reflective, reasoning adult  at least most of the time.

title: Are Poor Parents Poorer at Parenting?
description: Whenever we get too complacent around here  too black and white rather than gray; too quick to act on assumptions we dont even realize that we hold  Richard Weissbourd, a Harvard psychology lecturer and author of The Parents We Mean to Be: How Well-Intentioned Adults Undermine Childrens Moral and Emotional Development, comes by to remind us that things are far more complicated (and more interesting) than wed thought.

title: Perry Backs Full Israeli Control Over Jerusalem
description: UPDATE 2:30 p.m.: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas on Tuesday came down firmly on the side of the more conservative supporters of Israel, denouncing what he called an Obama administration policy of appeasement that had gravely weakened Israel and declaring unambiguously that Jerusalem should be fully under the control of the Israeli government.

title: Photos of the Moment | Christopher Kane
description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#905", 592, 400, true, chameleonData);Linda Brownlees London Fashion Week photo diary.

title: Dozens of Pilgrims on Bus in Pakistan Are Shot to Death
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Gunmen in the southwestern province of Baluchistan attacked a bus carrying Shiite pilgrims to Iran on Tuesday, killing at least 25 people and wounding 6 more, local police officials said.

title: Afghan Peace Council Chief Killed in Attack
description: Burhanuddin Rabbani, leader of Afghanistans High Peace Council and former president, was trying to negotiate a political ending to the the war with the Taliban.

title: Hospira Ramps Up Competition on Biologic Drug
description: Though still years behind Europe in the availability of cheaper copycat versions of some of the worlds most expensive prescriptions, savings on expensive drugs derived from biotechnology are inching closer to reality in the United States.

title: Stop-Gap Bill Tied Up Over Disaster Aid Feud
description: 1:59 p.m. | Updated  The House and Senate are headed for a showdown over a short-term bill to fund the government because of a disagreement over disaster relief funding.

title: Sony Binoculars That Take Video in 3-D
description: Why do like engineers like to graft together disparate devices? Shoes with a built in speaker and MP3 player come to mind as one of the stranger pairings, but the folks at Sony have come up with an electronic mash-up that makes surprising sense.

title: Disney to Add Avatar to Theme Parks
description: 3:56 p.m. | Updated LOS ANGELES  The world of Pandora is coming to Walt Disney World. In a deal that underscores Disneys continued spending on new theme park attractions, the entertainment conglomerate has obtained exclusive global theme park rights to the hit movie Avatar from 20th Century Fox, the two companies said on Tuesday morning. The partnership will include much more than a ride. Avatar, which sold $2.8 billion in tickets at the global box office, will form the foundation for a themed land at Animal Kingdom, the newest of the four major parks that make up Disney World in Orlando, Fla. Animal Kingdom is built around the theme of mankinds responsibility to nature, which is also the core message of Avatar.

title: Banished from the H.O.V. Lane, Prius Drivers May Be First to Embrace New Plug-In Model
description: Toyota announced last week that its plug-in Prius, with 15 miles of all-electric range, will cost $32,780 when it goes on sale early next year, $8,500 more than the entry-level Prius Two, which costs $24,280.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Mary Katrantzou
description: It took five people to carry the finale dress for Mary Katrantzou backstage before the show, where it was to be sewn onto a model after she was finished with hair and makeup. When it arrived, the full beauty look remained undecided as Val Garland was still mixing M.A.C. pigments to sort out the perfect 10 holographic shades to be painted on lips. If you look at the clothes, they are all really colorful and energetic, she said. Sam [McKnight] did great, sexy hair. It felt right to do a statement, but not makeup makeup. This meant choosing to do simply a striking mouth to complement the collection. Garlands been known to go on instinct when it comes to Katrantzou. It was during her first season that Garland decided to change up the makeup hours before the presentation. Twelve girls were sent out with 12 different versions of eyeliner, a look that ended up creating quite a stir. For spring, the bold lip needed little else save for a sheer, sparkling nail (Nailgirls Pink 19) and simple ponytail. Incredibly nave, childlike  and clean is how McKnight described the hair, which was pulled back with pieces pulled out as a veil all around the hairline, so that it wafts when she moves. To start, he wanted models to have perfectly washed hair, which was achieved by shampooing and conditioning with Pantene Color Protection products in the bathroom sink. The loos three floors over, McKnight said. They were not very happy about that.

title: In Rio de Janeiro, Juice Bars That Are More Than Juice
description: If you caught the recent front page article in the Times entitled Foreigners Follow Money to Booming Brazil, Land of $35 Martini, you know how expensive Brazil has become. By some measures, Rio de Janeiro and So Paulo are now more costly than London or New York or Oslo  amazing considering that some of their municipal services are more like those in La Paz or Dakar.

title: Murdoch and Perry Dine at Steak House
description: As part of his campaign swing through New York this week, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas is courting crucial constituencies, including Hispanic and Jewish voters.

title: Photos of the Moment | Burberry
description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#463", 592, 400, true, chameleonData);Linda Brownlees London Fashion Week photo diary.

title: Emanuel to Headline Jefferson-Jackson Dinner in Iowa
description: Four years ago, Barack Obama stole the show - and advanced his struggling candidacy - at the Jefferson-Jackson dinner in Iowa.

title: Repeal Day: The End of Dont Ask, Dont Tell
description: The 18-year-old dont ask, dont tell policy officially ended on Tuesday and with it the discharges that removed more than 13,000 men and women from the military under the old ban on openly gay troops. At War is providing updates in real time from the official Pentagon news conference where Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta and Adm. Mike Mullen, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, will usher in the new era, as well as reaction from around the Web.

title: S.E.C. Hid Its Lawyers Madoff Ties
description: After Bernard L. Madoffs giant Ponzi scheme was revealed, the Securities and Exchange Commission went to great lengths to make sure that none of its employees working on the case posed a conflict of interest, barring anyone who had accepted gifts or attended a Madoff wedding.

title: In Trying to Walk Away From Deal, Cerberus Has Weak MAC Claim
description: Cerberus Capital Management and Chatham Lodging Trust have a court date.

title: Reality Hits Some New York Housewives': Theyre Off the Show
description: Friends come and go, and so do housewives.

title: Saudi Prince Rebuts Claim of Rape in Spain
description: MADRID  The office of Prince Alwaleed bin Talal bin Abdulaziz al-Saud, a billionaire investor and nephew of King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia, released documents to rebut an accusation that the prince raped a Spanish woman on a luxury yacht off the Mediterranean island of Ibiza three years ago.

title: Islam Is More Ideology Than Religion, F.B.I. Analyst Says in Video
description: The video is dull  seminar room, dim lights, PowerPoint  but its message from an F.B.I. counterterrorism analyst is provocative: fighting Al Qaeda and other extremist groups is a waste compared to the broader threat posed by Islam itself.

title: First Prize for a Child in Somalia: An AK-47
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A typical prize for a childrens contest might be a backpack, a lunchbox or maybe some toys.

title: Joseph Ogrodnek of Anella Is Opening Battersby in Carroll Gardens
description: Joseph Ogrodnek, who left his job as executive chef at Anella in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, in February, has teamed up with Walker Stern, a friend and chef who also was at Anella, to open Battersby, a 30-seat spot for locavore cooking with influences from all over the map.

title: La Otra Cuba
description: Post-Fidel anticipation has tourists flocking to Cuba to bask in the sunset of the revolution: the patched-together Studebakers, the stuck-in-time streetscapes. But visitors often leave without a real sense of the islands rich, pre-Communist past, much less its inscrutable present  both the subjects of new photo books. Michael Dwecks Habana Libre (above left, Damiani, $65) is a sun-baked Whos Who of Cubas cultural elite. Michael Connorss Splendor of Cuba (above right, Rizzoli, $85) catalogs the countrys 450-year architectural history, casting a rosy eye on exquisitely preserved examples of Spanish-Creole colonial style.

title: Of Beach Sand, War and Carbon
description: Three years ago, my colleague Andrew Ross Sorkin caught the British entrepreneur Richard Branson on his private island in the Caribbean in a pensive moment. With a little help from his friends, he was thinking hard about the problem of global warming, and whether he might be able to help.

title: Our Familys Experiment in Extreme Schooling: a Postscript
description: How are they doing now?

title: Google+ Opens Up to All Comers
description: Google on Tuesday opened its invitation-only social network, Google+, to anyone who wants to join at google.com/+.

title: Photo Replay: Sept. 20
description: The day in sports included the Asian basketball championships in China and the Rugby World Cup in New Zealand.

title: UBS Adds to Energy Banking Team With New Hires
description: While UBS is grappling with the fallout from a traders $2.3 billion loss, its American investment banking arm is continuing to rebuild with additional hires.

title: Long Before Dont Ask, Dont Tell, I Suffered and Won
description: FORTY-THREE years ago, I peered out the door of a United States Army helicopter as it flew low over the smoking ruins of a Vietnamese village. Acrid fumes of still-burning thatch  hours earlier the rooftops of orderly houses  assaulted my eyes and nose as I stepped out onto a bed of ashes in a smoldering rice field.

title: Sampling the Tastes of the Civil War
description: Daniel Mowles preparing roasted rabbits for a tasting of Civil War-era food at the Roger Smith Hotel on Monday.The chef, it turned out, was from southwest Virginia and grew up in a household that, he said, had inherited some of Robert E. Lees silverware.

title: Battle of the Subs: Alvin vs. Jason
description: Jeffrey Marlow, a graduate student at the California Institute of Technology, writes from a workstation off the coast of Oregon, where he is studying life around deep-ocean vents.

title: Poker Web Site Cheated Users, U.S. Suit Says
description: The millions of people who signed up for a Web site called Full Tilt Poker knew they were there to gamble. But it turns out they were taking on far more risk than they realized, even when they had no chips on the virtual table.

title: The Ever-Shifting Balance Between Resources and Dreams
description: Carl Richards is a certified financial planner in Park City, Utah. His sketches are archived here on the Bucks blog and on his personal Web site, BehaviorGap.com.

title: American Is to Join the Bolshoi Ballet
description: Exactly 50 years after Rudolf Nureyev grabbed the worlds attention as the first major Soviet dancer to defect to the West, another symbolic journey is taking place  this time in reverse.

title: Dining, Music and More Will Enliven La Rotonde in Paris
description: La Rotonde, the neo-Classical monument overlooking the Bassin de la Villette in the 19th Arrondissement in Paris, is finally seeing new life after sitting empty for years.

title: Profile in Style | Perry Farrell
description: The notoriously wild frontman for Janes Addiction and Porno for Pyros may have settled down, but hes still a rolling stone, thanks to a demanding tour schedule that includes Lollapalooza, the seminal music festival he founded in Chicago in 1991, and its off shoots in Chile and  starting next year  Brazil. Farrell and his wife, Etty, a dancer who often performs with him, are virtually inseparable. She auditioned for Janes Addiction in 1997, and I fell in love with her at first sight, he says. Weve been traveling together in one capacity or another ever since. Their happy place? The cliff-top pineapple field in Maui where they tied the knot. Go to our interactive feature >>

title: Reviewing St. Anselm
description: Reviewing St. Anselm

title: Reviewing St. Anselm
description: This weeks restaurant review: St. Anselm, out on Metropolitan Avenue in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, across the street from Fette Sau, and next door to Spuyten Duyvil.

title: Playing With Fire and Winning
description: ST. ANSELM is a restaurant on Metropolitan Avenue in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, right where Havemeyer Street doglegs out of its run of wig shops and bodegas to become residential. It is an offshoot of Joe Carrolls barbecue restaurant Fette Sau, across the street, and of his bar Spuyten Duyvil, next door.

title: Chinese Journalist Following Gutter Oil Scandal Is Found Dead
description: A Chinese journalist reporting on a scandal surrounding illegal cooking oil was found stabbed to death this week, the journalism advocacy group Reporters Without Borders said on Tuesday.

title: Iraq Calls for Change of Syrian Regime
description: BAGHDAD  After months of striking a far friendlier tone toward the government of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, the Iraqi government has joined a chorus of other nations calling on him to step down.

title: G.M. Deal to Hire More at Low End
description: DETROIT  The new labor contract between General Motors and the United Automobile Workers will accelerate the hiring of lower-paid, entry-level workers at the company and bring jobs to the United States that were headed for Mexico.

title: Character vs. Characterization: Examining How Candidates and Politicians Are Defined
description: Overview | Why do candidates for public office often become best known for just one action, stance or personality trait? How do narrow, popular definitions of politicians affect our electoral process? In this lesson, students examine how the current candidates for president of the United States have become defined in the media and create equally applicable alternate definitions for each candidate.

title: Another View: Lets License Corporate Directors
description: Jonathan F. Foster is the founder and managing director of Current Capital.

title: Where to Look Up Dry-Hopping and Decoction
description: THE other night I put on my best suit and tie and went out to drink some beer. Sounds absurd, I know. Even the most dedicated beer lovers lean more toward T-shirts and comfy clothes, which is really as it should be. Yet the fact that beer can also be presented beautifully and appropriately for a dressed-up crowd signals that American beer culture has progressed far beyond what anybody but the most visionary beer fanatic ever imagined.

title: Spotted on the Street | Heewon Kim
description: The Girl: Heewon Kim, a fashion stylist and the executive director of the store Qlosette, a womens clothing boutique.

title: A Satire of the Avant-Garde, With a Side of Fresh Food
description: The avant-garde is meaningless is the kind of thing that a character in a satire of the avant-garde, like Connis Avant Garde Restaurant: The Mothership Landing, would say. And yet the show  interactive theater featuring witless spectacle, stale comedy and fresh food  is arguably an argument for that point.

title: Sheen, Then and Now, Gets Big Ratings
description: He may have made himself a pariah at his old studio and network, but Charlie Sheen proved Monday night that he remains a television ratings force - or force field at least.

title: Developers Cater to Two-Wheeled Traffic in Portland, Ore.
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Christian Ettinger, the owner of Hopworks Urban Brewery here, is a longtime bicycle enthusiast. He grew up riding around the Portland suburb of Lake Oswego, and now owns six bicycles  two if my wife is asking  and races in cyclocross events. So when he decided to open a second brewpub this summer, he settled on a location that reflected his passion: North Williams Avenue, one of the most-used commuter cycling corridors in a city already mad for all things two-wheeled.

title: My Three Favorite Meals Within Walking Distance of the Times Building
description: Virgils BBQThe wings are undisputed. Smoked to perfection, served as an appetizer big enough to serve as a meal for two.

title: Ex-Automotive Executives Select Start-Ups for Green Incubator
description: Greenstart, a San Francisco green technology start-up accelerator created by three entrepreneurs with backgrounds in automotive advertising, pulled the sheets off its first round of investments on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Qaddafi Calls New Libya Government a Propped-Up Charade
description: MISURATA, Libya  As world leaders at the United Nations were embracing the rebels who overthrew him, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi broke nearly two weeks of silence on Tuesday, denouncing Libyas new interim government and predicting its quick demise once NATO warplanes end their attacks on his forces.

title: Photos of the Moment | Meadham Kirchhoff
description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#525", 592, 400, true, chameleonData);

title: Predicting Sex Life After Prostate Cancer
description: Treatments for prostate cancer take a significant toll on male potency, leaving a surprisingly high percentage of men unable to have a normal sex life, new research shows.

title: Google+ for Everyone: What You Need to Know
description: Three months ago, Google launched an all-out, brazen competitor to Facebook called Google+  pronounced Google plus. Googles rival network offered several features that addressed frequent complaints about Facebook.

title: America: Land of the Slow
description: 4:47 p.m. | Updated to clarify that the rankings in the report were condensed.

title: Fragmented Dreams and a Send-Up of Celebrity
description: Sequitur, the new-music ensemble directed by the composer Harold Meltzer and the pianist Sara Laimon, opened its 15th season with a characteristically freewheeling collection of works on Monday evening at Merkin Concert Hall. An attentive listener would be hard pressed to deduce the groups stylistic preferences, but maybe thats as it should be, given the eclectic nature of the contemporary music world.

title: Off the Runway: London Fashion Week
description: Scenes from London Fashion Week.

title: Bank of America Cuts Include 13 Industrials Bankers
description: 5:43 p.m. | Updated Thirteen members of Bank of America Merrill Lynchs industrials investment banking group were among the 3,500 job cuts carried out by the firm earlier this month, a person briefed on the matter told DealBook on Tuesday.

title: Pictures of the Day: California and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from the California, Afghanistan, Turkey and Pakistan

title: Guilty Verdict Reached in Another Insider Trading Case
description: 8:22 p.m. | Updated  A former salesman at a Silicon Valley research firm was found guilty of conspiracy and wire fraud on Tuesday, the latest person to be convicted in the governments sweeping investigation into insider trading at hedge funds.

title: At Hotels, Perks You Can Pet
description: Some hotels seem to have gone to the dogs  literally. Canines are now on staff at hotels across the country, from urban addresses to rural retreats, as perks you can pet.

title: TimesCast | September 20, 2011
description: A suicide bomber kills Kabuls lead negotiator with the Taliban; a Georgia inmate loses his bid for clemency; and Roger Cohen on the diminished role of President Ahmadinejad of Iran.

title: Red Bulls Need Rost to Stand Tall
description: LITTLE FALLS, N.J.  When he is walking alone as he makes his way to the practice field, or runs laps, Frank Rost looks deceptively diminutive. That feeling evaporates once you are standing next to the Red Bulls 6-foot-5 goalkeeper.

title: Doom!
description: Thats the title of a new article by John Judis about how policy around the advanced world is now aggravating the slump  and how things look likely to get even worse looking forward. Its not very different from what Ive been saying, but Judis offers more historical depth in the comparison with the 30s.

title: Former NPR Official Gets New Position
description: 6:20 p.m. | Updated Nine months after resigning as senior vice president for news at National Public Radio, Ellen Weiss has been named executive editor at the Center for Public Integrity, a non-profit investigative news organization in Washington.

title: Laugh Lines | Revisiting William Steig
description: What a splendid gift it would be if the works tearing up the best-seller lists werent that of a Stieg Larsson, but a Steig, William. If, rather than girls with inadvisable tattoos playing with fire, we had Sylvester and the Magic Pebble, Abels Island or even The Lonely Ones clawing to the top in a fit of posthumous re-appreciation for a modest artist of tremendous ability. Alas.

title: Adapting for New Timbres
description: The art of arrangement, in which musical works are retooled for instruments other than those indicated by their composers, is an old and venerable undertaking. Before the advent of recording, most listeners got to know new symphonies and operas through piano versions played at home. And poaching works meant for other players has been a prime source of enrichment for instruments with undernourished repertories, like the guitar and the saxophone.

title: Noshing Down Mulberry Street
description: IN Little Italy it is time for deep-fried Oreos, for mozzarepas and banana daiquiris in tubular cups like bongs. Above, a tinsel bower of red, green and silver. Underfoot, oily napkins and the scent of Peronis.

title: Svidler, Russian Grandmaster, Wins World Chess Cup
description: Peter Svidler, a Russian grandmaster, won the 2011 World Chess Cup on Monday by holding his opponent, Alexander Grischuk, a fellow Russian, to a draw. That clinched the match for Svidler by a score of 2.5 to 1.5.

title: Financial District Protests Continue as 7 More Are Arrested
description: Seven protesters were arrested on Tuesday downtown in Zuccotti Park in the continuing unrest in the financial district, the police said.

title: Oracle Posts Solid Gains in a Sector in Turmoil
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Strong corporate demand for software helped to lift Oracles sales 12 percent in its first quarter despite a choppy economy and sagging demand for its hardware.

title: ConAgra Misses Profit Estimates
description: ConAgra Foods, the maker of Banquet frozen meals and Orville Redenbacher popcorn, reported a quarterly profit Tuesday that missed analysts estimates. And the chief executive, Gary M. Rodkin, said the company was looking at a number of acquisition targets after having withdrawn its offer for Ralcorp Holdings.

title: Pictures of the Day: California and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from the California, Afghanistan, Turkey and Pakistan.

title: Art at the Food Cart and in the Park
description: In The Conspiracy of Performance, the choreographer Trajal Harrell and the actress Perle Palombe have much to say about current movement-based art. Inspired by Jean Baudrillards essay The Conspiracy of Art, this work rages against mediocrity, unoriginality, banality and nothingness. Within it there are also echoes of Yvonne Rainers No manifesto from 1965, which fought against spectacle, virtuosity, camp and style.

title: Wheelies: The Awkward Embraces Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: A Climate Reality Presenter Weighs Gore Project
description: Katie Carpenter, a veteran producer of environmental documentaries (I first crossed paths with her while writing on deforestation in the Amazon in the late 1980s), was one of the presenters in the 24 Hours of Reality climate web-athon organized by former Vice President Al Gore. (Heres his summary presentation.)

title: Airline Trade Group Revises Its Profit Forecast Higher for 2011
description: PARIS  Worldwide demand for air travel remains well above average despite clear signs of a broad economic slowdown, a group representing most of the worlds airlines said on Tuesday, leading the group to raise its profit forecast substantially for the year.

title: New U.S. Envoy Urges China to Relax Business Restrictions
description: BEIJING  The new United States ambassador to China, Gary F. Locke, warned China on Tuesday that its undervalued currency, its increasingly restrictive business environment and the rampant theft of intellectual property threatened both the countrys long-term economic prospects and American job growth at a time of continued weakness in the global economy.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Peter Pilotto
description: What shape is a shoe box? asked the hairstylist Duffy backstage at Peter Pilotto. Oblong? Duffy was trying to explain the rectangular woven patch he created at the top of the head to mimic the cross-hatch pattern on the collections clothes. Clean, sleek and structured, is how he described the textured shoe box secured into a tight, slicked-back ponytail, to contrast the soft, feminine, fluid hair left loose beneath it. Nails, like the hair, were intended to be polished, but discreetly so as not to compete with the bright colors of the clothes. This meant Essies Jazz on fingers and toes. Makeup, on the other end, was all about shine. M.A.C. Lustre drops were mixed with Strobe Liquid Lotion and applied all over the body by Adrien Pinault and team. Taupe blush and Creme Colour Base in Dusk were used on the face with the latter brushed onto the lips and coated with clear gloss. There was no mascara and brows were simply brushed, perhaps so as not to distract from the handiwork of the shoe box shape in the hair.

title: Cathy Horyn Interviews Alber Elbaz
description: Ms. Horyn asks Alber Elbaz about his fall collection, the lines promotional video and more. For the whole interview here.

title: Response to Tropical Storm Irene Cost $55 Million, City Says
description: Tropical Storm Irene did not wreak the kind of havoc that was feared within New York City, but the storm was still expensive.

title: Clowning Around
description: Barry Lubin, the 59-year old star clown known as Grandma, is saying farewell to the Big Apple Circus.

title: The Daily Shoe | Mary Katrantzou
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Weaving Climate Into Corporate
description: A new report finds more evidence that climate change is gradually moving to the center of corporate strategy. Virtually every big company in the world now pays at least lip service to sustainability, and many of them are starting to take real action to reduce their environmental footprint. The new report from the Carbon Disclosure Project finds that for the first time, a majority of companies in the United States responding to the groups survey now integrate climate change into core business strategy.

title: Pentagon Leaders Commend End of Dont Ask Policy
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagons top civilian and military leaders hailed the repeal on Tuesday of the dont ask, dont tell policy as a historic event, saying that allowing gay men and lesbians to serve openly in the armed forces would preserve American values without diminishing the nations combat power.

title: Neon City
description: Kirsten Hively goes around the city photographing neon. A sampling of her work follows.

title: White House Deputy Communications Director Steps Down
description: President Obama is losing one of his longest-serving aides, Jennifer Psaki, who has been a witness to the varied crises of his campaign and presidency and the unflappable and genial point-person to reporters covering those events.

title: Big Man of the Big Top Bids It Adieu
description: WALDEN, N.Y.  Some might think it an inappropriate beginning for a grand farewell tour, but certainly not Grandma, a k a Barry Lubin. Here was Mr. Lubin, the 59-year old star clown who began fooling around at the Big Apple Circus 29 years ago, being lassoed by two magicians at the shows cavernous practice arena in this woodsy patch of the Hudson Valley.

title: Top Restaurants Face Scrutiny Over Access to the Disabled
description: Many of Manhattans top restaurants will soon receive mailings from a federal prosecutors office in New York checking whether they are accessible to disabled patrons.

title: Nevadas Dean Heller Gives First Senate Speech
description: Senator Dean Heller, Republican of Nevada, who was promoted in the spring from the House, gave his maiden speech in the Senate on Tuesday. In a roughly 15-minute speech from the chamber floor, he channeled his inner Mark Twain and called for the lawmakers to come together to create jobs and address the governments long-term fiscal problems.

title: TimesCast | Inmate Denied Clemency
description: September 20, 2011 - The controversy surrounding the impending execution of Troy Davis highlights the rift in national opinion over the death penalty.

title: The Caucus Click: Bachmanns Red Meat
Channel Surfing: Workaholics
description: Sometimes its best not to know too much about certain things. What your kids are looking at online. How hot dogs are made. What all those deductions on your paycheck stub are for. The happy idiots at the center of Workaholics, a pleasantly daffy bro-comedy that starts its second season Tuesday at 10:30 p.m. on Comedy Central, begin the episode by scrutinizing their check stubs, apparently for the first time, and come to the realization that they pay taxes. Their resulting assumptions lead to dragon theft, a trip back to high school and, of course, party time.

title: Hungarian Rhapsody
description: A rich film tradition and low production costs have long brought stars to Budapest, among them Jeremy Irons, 63, pictured here on the shores of the Danube River. Irons made Nijinski, his first movie in the capital, in 1980, and returned to make M. Butterfly, Being Julia and Showtimes The Borgias. When not on set, Irons explores the citys wonderful crumbling faded beauty on his motorcycle. Its very hard to find the soul of a city, he says, but he suggests starting at the Dohany Street Synagogue (011-36-1-413-5500), the Hungarian State Opera (right; opera.hu) and the Western Railway Station (Terez korut at Nyugati ter), designed by the Eiffel Company of Paris. Irons also recommends Cafe Kor (011-36-1-311-0053; cafekor.com), Pomo DOro (011-36-1-302-6473; pomodorobudapest.com) and Nobu (noburestaurants.com/budapest), inside the Kempinski Hotel (011-36-1-429-3777; kempinski.com), where he usually stays.

title: Splashing Through Rain Toward a Silent Afterlife
description: From a sensory perspective, Crane Story is consistently gorgeous.

title: Musings About Death, Joyce-Style
description: James Joyce is your father and Samuel Beckett is one of your boyfriends. How do you make your own path? You try to become an artist, of course, a dancer (be gone, words!), but instead end up institutionalized for almost 50 years. Thats the story of Lucia Joyce, thwarted artist, crazy person and subject of Lucias Chapters of Coming Forth by Day, a suggestive but unsatisfying Mabou Mines production written and directed by Sharon Fogarty that is having its New York premiere as part of the 1st Irish Theater Festival.

title: Mets Recall a Time Rivera Blew One
description: On Monday, Mariano Rivera saved his record 602nd game.

title: To Tourists, Greek Debt Crisis Is a Distant Concept
description: ATHENS  Despite all the gloom surrounding Greece and its battered economy, the sun has been shining on the countrys tourism industry, offering one of the few glimmers of hope for recovery.

title: Food From North and South
description: The dishes below were served at a tasting at a Manhattan hotel, the Roger Smith, on Lexington Avenue near 47th Street.

title: Im Proud to Be a Citizen': 18 Are Sworn In
description: Festus Cohill has earned many titles during his time in the United States: Vietnam War veteran. Cancer survivor. Bartender extraordinaire. Fianc, twice, though never husband.

title: Gary Johnson Earns Debate Spot
description: The Republican presidential field may be headed toward a two-man race between Rick Perry and Mitt Romney, but dont tell that to Gary Johnson, the former governor of New Mexico.

title: Singing Gladiator Time
description: Lets have a look at the absence entry of a quotable quotes Web site to see what might apply to Simon Cowell. Absence makes the heart grow fonder? Too easy, and in this case of dubious accuracy. God is absence (Sartre)? Intriguing but irrelevant. Barbarism is the absence of standards to which appeal can be made (Jos Ortega y Gasset)? Has the word absence in it and actually nicely describes some of Mr. Cowells previous work as a judge on American Idol, but its not quite what were after.

title: Away From the Limelight and Losing Her Grip
description: For Colleen West, the actress played by Ellen Barkin in ____ Year, it was  as the unprintable title of this experimental narrative suggests  a long, lousy time, and now its gone, Baby, gone. Having announced that shes retiring from acting, Colleen moves to a cabin in the country and into her memories of a younger man she calls her latest disappointment, Harvey (Luke Grimes), a beauty with a sensitive pout and fogged-over eyes. She also strikes up a friendship of sorts with a neighbor (Melora Walters) and is visited by her brother (a funny Bob Einstein). Every so often, Colleen appears to visit an extraterrestrial therapist. Or something.

title: At Madison Square Garden, its Hey, Getcher Lobster Roll
description: ANDREW CARMELLINI leaned forward with some intensity at his window table in his restaurant the Dutch, reflecting on the culinary architecture of his new Cheddar brat. The Schaller & Weber sausage? Its braised in Hoegaarden beer from Belgium, he said. The sauerkraut? Call it weinkraut please, since its cooked in riesling. The bread? Thats a Martins potato bun that must be warm, but not toasted.

title: Recipes for Rosh Hashana
description: Festive and familiar dishes for celebrating the Jewish New Year.

title: After His Brothers Killing, a Chef Turns to Israeli Food
description: Philadelphia

title: Photos of the Moment | Pringle of Scotland
description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#784", 592, 400, true, chameleonData);

title: Not All Bones Go to the Dogs
description: A year ago, Poilne, the Paris bakery, created a bone-shaped butter cookie called Pas Pour Les Chiens (not for dogs). Olivier Kuntzel and Florence Deygas, artists known for the playful cartoon dogs Caperino and Peperone, helped design them. With a mix of pink and Sichuan peppercorns, nutmeg and mace made by Lior Lev Sercarz, who specializes in spice blends for chefs, the cookies bridge savory and sweet, making them good with cheese, cocktails or ice cream. Mr. Sercarz also sells them at his gallery-shop in New York.

title: Artichoke Basilles Arrives in the Frozen-Food Aisle
description: About three years ago Francis Garcia took his artichoke pie from his familys restaurant on Staten Island to the Artichoke Basilles Pizza Company, which he opened on East 14th Street with his cousin Sal Basille. But even after opening more restaurants, Mr. Garcia nurtured a dream of seeing his pizzas in supermarkets. After months of trial and error, he found a family-owned company that makes frozen pizzas to his liking. The proportion of topping to crust on the frozen artichoke pizza is better balance than whats sold at the pizzerias. A margherita version is well flavored but can use a few shreds of fresh mozzarella.

title: Heritage Meat Shop Opens at Essex Street Market
description: Patrick Martins has opened the first shop, in the Essex Street Market, for his Heritage Foods USA, the online retailer. He has set up in space that had been Jeffreys Meat Market for more than 70 years, and hired Dionisio Silva (left), a Jeffreys butcher. The shop stocks smoked and fresh pork from different heirloom breeds, grass-fed beef, poultry (including the turkeys Heritage is best known for), and cured meats from domestic producers, including Armandino Batali in Seattle. It also has sandwiches, some packaged food, and, at the end of the day, Staff Meal cuts of meat for $3.99 a pound.

title: Roger Cohen on Ahmadinejad
description: The Op-Ed columnist Roger Cohen on the diminished role of President Ahmadinejad of Iran as he arrives in New York for the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Consumer Bureau Readies Its New Financial Rules
description: Raj Date, the former banker temporarily leading the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, outlined a timeline on Tuesday for the Wall Street watchdog to unveil a string of new regulations.

title: Amorous Squid Seeks Partner: Any Sex Will Do
description: A five-and-a-half-inch deep-sea squid that lives a solitary life up to half a mile down in the dark waters of the Pacific Ocean is the latest addition to the hundreds of species that are known to engage in same-sex sex.

title: What Are You Cooking for Rosh Hashana?
description: The Jewish New Year is approaching  will you be turning to your great-aunts brisket recipe, or this one from the chef Michael Solomonov, who braises the meat in pomegranate juice? Are you making matzo ball soup? Babka: cinnamon or chocolate?

title: Bloggingheads: Is Perry Too Extreme?
description: Evan Smith, left, of The Texas Tribune and Joshua Trevino of the Texas Public Policy Foundation debate the 2012 election.

title: Talks End in Greece With No Deal, but Progress Is Reported
description: Inspectors from top international groups will return to Greece next week to reassess the countrys progress in meeting the requirements for it to receive financial assistance, as talks ended Tuesday without an agreement in place.

title: Would Al Gore Have Won in 2000 Without the Electoral College?
description: George W. Bush won the Electoral College in 2000 following the recount in Florida. But Al Gore received more popular votes  about 540,000 more than Mr. Bush nationally, or about 0.5 percent of all votes cast across the country.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,761 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans this week:

title: TimesCast | Afghan Peace Chief Killed
description: Burhanuddin Rabbani, the leader of Afghanistans High Peace Council, was assassinated Tuesday night by a suicide bomber with explosives tucked in his turban.

title: $16 Muffins, and Taxpayers Pick Up the Tab
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department on Tuesday came under criticism for extravagant and potentially wasteful spending on conferences at the end of the Bush administration and early in the Obama administration, including paying $16 per muffin and $8 per eight-ounce cup of coffee at certain events.

title: G.M. Plans to Develop Electric Cars With China
description: HONG KONG  General Motors said Tuesday that it would develop electric cars in China through a joint venture with a Chinese automaker, and would transfer battery and other electric car technology to the venture.

title: A Weak Board at Yahoo Stumbles in a Series of Missteps
description: Yahoos board is arguably not the worst in America.

title: Yankees in Position to Do Red Sox a Favor
description: Yankees center fielder Curtis Granderson reported to the ballpark Tuesday afternoon claiming to have no idea what his teams magic numbers were. (They were four for clinching a playoff spot and five for clinching the American League East title, by the way.)

title: UBS Senior Staff Should Feel Losses
description: Will UBSs rogue trader leave the banks staff members with doughnut bonuses? The investment banks employees, already facing thousands of job cuts, fear that the $2.3 billion trading loss will wipe out this years payouts. Loading the cost onto the staff could appease shareholders and regulators, but it would risk causing another exodus. Clawing back deferred bonuses from senior staff members might be a better option.

title: Congress Reacts to Dont Ask Repeal
description: For lawmakers on Capitol Hill, reaction Tuesday to the end of the /a>dont ask, dont tell policy largely followed the lines of the years-long debate over banning gay men and lesbians from serving openly in the military.

title: Capital One Denies ING Deal Would Make It Too Big to Fail
description: 8:08 p.m. | Updated  Capital One on Tuesday delivered a sweeping defense of its proposed $9 billion takeover of ING Direct USA, aiming to allay concerns that the deal would create another too big to fail banking giant.

title: Giants First Win Brings Sighs, Not All of Relief
description: Beginning in training camp and continuing through last weeks season-opening loss to the Washington Redskins, injuries severely hobbled the Giants defense.

title: A Bankers Secret Wealth
description: Emilio Botn is a billionaire Spanish banker renowned for running a tight ship. He asks that his top credit officers at Santander  one of Europes largest banks  make a trek to his vacation home each summer to report on loan exposures. And he queries the head of his charitable foundation, euro for euro, on its smallest donations.

title: Digg Introduces Genre-Specific Newsrooms
description: Digg, the social news Web site, opened a series of online newsrooms Tuesday that will use social networks to determine the importance of a news story.

title: A Grievous Wrong
description: Troy Davis is scheduled to be executed on Wednesday for the 1989 killing of a police officer in Savannah, Ga. The Georgia pardon and parole boards refusal to grant him clemency is appalling in light of developments after his conviction: reports about police misconduct, the recantation of testimony by a string of eyewitnesses and reports from other witnesses that another person had confessed to the crime.

title: A Year of Living, Working and Grieving on Tour
description: ATLANTA  Volunteering is about helping others. In the best case, it also helps the volunteer.

title: William F. May, 95, Dies; Helped Found Film Society
description: William F. May, who led the American Can Company during a 15-year period of expansion beginning in 1965 and helped found the Film Society of Lincoln Center, died on Sunday in Greenwich, Conn. He was 95.

title: Risks Seen for Children of Illegal Immigrants
description: Children whose parents are illegal immigrants or who lack legal status themselves face uniformly negative effects on their social development from early childhood until they become adults, according to a study by four researchers published Wednesday in the Harvard Educational Review.

title: To Address a Reshaped Market, Grey Adds a Unit
description: EXECUTIVES at one of the worlds largest agencies are making a business choice that they hope will turn out to be a healthy choice.

title: TV Chefs Through the Years
description: A survey of chefs who have taught Americans to cook, from James Beard and Julia Child to the current generation of Food Network stars.

title: Throwing Out the Recipe for Daytime TV
description: UNDER the hot lights of ABCs Studio 2 last week, a mound of hamburger meat glistened, as pink and moist as the chef Mario Batalis forehead. Dozens of assistants, makeup artists and publicists watched in rapt silence as Carla Hall, a recovering caterer who has competed twice on Bravos Top Chef, rehearsed a segment on turkey wraps.

title: One in Three Texters Would Rather Text Than Talk
description: My 3-year-old told my husband the other day to send me a text message. She intuitively understood that I prefer to see his words on my screen than hear his voice. Texts are discreet. Texts are pithy.

title: West Hollywood to Ban Sale of Fur Garments
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif. This is a small city, a mere 1.9 square miles, with about 36,000 residents. But lawmakers here nonetheless see themselves as national trendsetters.

title: Time to Boycott Tuna Again?
description: I wish Id been in La Jolla a couple of weeks ago to see the green inflatable airship flying overhead with a cartoon mermaid on one side. She was curvy and blonde, with a cigarette in her mouth and a bloody fish impaled on her trident. Around her was text that read, Chicken of the Sea: Carnage in a Tuna Can.

title: The Health Payoffs of Time Banks
description: Fridays Fixes post about time banks resonated with readers. Time banks are local organizations that allow people to use their skills to help others by exchanging hours instead of money. You earn time dollars by, say, taking a neighbor to the doctor, and spend those time dollars on the same number of hours worth of other services, such as computer repair or singing lessons. Strikingly, very few readers talked about what they could get from time banks; most responded to the possibility of giving. The chance to help others and feel good about myself makes the bargain seem better than I thought possible, wrote Ajasys from Vancouver, Wash. (41)  a typical comment.

title: Dining Calendar
description: A 'Boatload of Wines

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening

title: Joe Dressner, Wine Importer, Dies at 60
description: Joe Dressner, an importer whose advocacy of Old World wines made without chemicals or manipulation inspired a sort of natural wine avant-garde, died Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 60.

title: Inters Gasperini: Dead Man Coaching
description: Inter Milan Coach Gian Piero Gasperini may be out of a job by the time you read this. The final nail in his coffin was almost certainly Inters 3-1 loss at newly promoted NovaraTuesday, though there has been so much hammering of nails into that box in the past month that its hard to say which one finally did him in.

title: Nevada: Air Crash Toll Rises to 11
description: The death toll from a plane crash at the National Championship Air Races in Reno rose to 11 on Tuesday, officials said. The police said that the latest victim, who was not identified, died from injuries when a World War II-era P-51 Mustang fighter plane nosedived into the crowd Friday. Medical examiners have identified 10 victims.

title: Red Meat for N.F.L. Fans: Football Channel Sees All
description: Like many N.F.L. fans, Mike Tanenbaum grew up watching games each Sunday with his father. They gathered around their television and cheered on their team, the Jets, in an act of shared familial devotion  to sport, franchise and the standard network broadcast.

title: For Zimbabwe Premier, Optimism and Caution
description: The prime minister of Zimbabwe, one of southern Africas poorest and most politically anxious countries, expressed hope on Tuesday that elections for a new government could be held next year, bringing an end to an awkward and rancorous power-sharing partnership between him and his rival, the countrys legendarily autocratic president, Robert Mugabe.

title: Outside Baseball Stadiums, a Solid Lineup
description: Statues depicting bygone baseball players seem to be multiplying, dressing up stadium grounds and serving as meeting places for fans.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Political Chess
description: To the Editor:

title: Political Shift in California Trips Brown
description: SACRAMENTO  Jerry Brown ran for governor on the argument that his age and experience  the son of a governor, he has spent a lifetime in politics, including two terms as governor himself 30 years ago  was what California needed to rescue it from a spiral of partisanship and financial decline as destructive as anywhere in the nation.

title: In Cuts to Health Programs, Experts See Difficult Task in Protecting Patients
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama and some members of Congress assert that, in cutting Medicare and Medicaid, they can whack health care providers while protecting beneficiaries. But experts say it is not so simple.

title: A Tax Others Embrace, U.S. Opposes
description: President Obamas proposal for a new tax on millionaires echoes a call in many countries struggling with budget deficits and overwhelming debts to make the wealthy pay more.

title: New York Judge Seeks New System for Juveniles
description: New York State has long dealt with 16- and 17-year-old defendants more severely than almost every other state, trying all of them as adults in criminal courts. Now, New Yorks chief judge is calling for a less punitive approach that would focus on finding ways to rehabilitate them.

title: Lottery Numbers
Obamas Plan to Raise Taxes on the Rich
description: To the Editor:

title: Anger and Suspicion as Survivors Await Chinese Crash Report
description: WENZHOU, China  When a high-speed train rammed into the rear of a second train on July 23 on a viaduct outside this eastern coastal city, the impact cost Chen Lihua, a 38-year-old father of two, eight broken ribs, a punctured lung and one shattered kneecap. His brother died of head wounds.

title: In Baseballs Bronze Age, Statues Are Becoming Bigger Part of Landscape
description: ATLANTA  Rob Warnock lingered last week in the shadow of a striking bronze sculpture just outside Turner Field. He had been assigned to hand out Braves tickets for his companys employee-recruitment gathering at that nights game, and, thinking about where to rendezvous, had said to his boss, Which gate?

title: Google Says It Plays Fair
description: In written testimony to a Senate antitrust panel where he will testify Wednesday afternoon, Eric Schmidt, Googles chairman, describes the search giant as a company facing fierce competition on many fronts, a relentless innovator in a dynamic industry and a creation of the open Internet so consumers can easily switch to competing services.

title: Pac-12 Decides to Stay at 12 Teams
description: With two unexpected plot twists emerging Tuesday in the seemingly endless drama of conference realignment, the turbulent world of college athletics has suddenly appeared to stabilize.

title: In 7-Page Note, Drug Lord Asks a Judge for Leniency
description: Good day to you, sir, the letter to the judge began. I am humbly asking if you could be lenient on me.

title: After Disclosures by WikiLeaks, Al Jazeera Replaces Its Top News Director
description: CAIRO  Al Jazeera, the pan-Arab news network financed by Qatar, named a member of the Qatari royal family on Tuesday to replace its top news director after disclosures from the group WikiLeaks indicating that the news director had modified the networks coverage of the Iraq war in response to pressure from the United States.

title: Anger as Chinese Await Crash Report
description: A government panel is expected to release a report on the high-speed train crash but survivors say they have already reached their own conclusions.

title: Republicans and a Vaccine
description: To the Editor:

title: The Runaway Cat
description: To the Editor:

title: Nickel Sales Just the Tonic for a Soda Fountains Revival
description: AVA, Mo.  A child takes a stool at a soda fountain, drops a nickel on the counter and orders a chocolate ice cream cone. This nostalgic tableau  backed by 50s tunes piping out of a jukebox  is fodder for the brush strokes of Norman Rockwell paintings and when-I-was-your-age stories spun by grandparents.

title: Dominican Aid to Haiti: An Ambassadors View
description: To the Editor:

title: Gay Re-enlistment
description: To the Editor:

title: Despite Wiretaps and Economic Woe, Berlusconi Endures
description: ROME  In the latest round of wiretaps to emerge in the Italian news media, Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi is heard ordering up young women for his parties  allegedly flying some in on state planes  and complaining in 2008 that official meetings with President Nicolas Sarkozy of France, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and Pope Benedict XVI were getting in the way of his social life.

title: How to Weaken the Power of Foreign Oil
description: OUR country has just gone through a sober national retrospective on the 9/11 attacks. Apart from the heartfelt honoring of those lost  on that day and since  what seemed most striking is our seeming passivity and indifference toward the well from which our enemies draw their political strength and financial power: the strategic importance of oil, which provides the wherewithal for a generational war against us, as we mutter diplomatic niceties.

title: Recounting the Dead
description: Even as Civil War history has gone through several cycles of revision, one thing has remained fixed: the number of dead. Since about 1900, historians and the general public have assumed that 618,222 men died on both sides. That number is probably a significant undercount, however. New estimates, based on Census data, indicate that the death toll was approximately 750,000, and may have been as high as 850,000.

title: Red Sox Exude That Old-Time Sinking Feeling
description: BOSTON  On a gray and gloomy September afternoon, on the 20th day of what may be memorialized as the Great Red Sox Collapse of 2011, came a rude intrusion from 2004.

title: Putting the Caped Crusader on the Couch
description: Los Angeles

title: Tenants Fret Over Big Debt at a Top Address
description: In 1994, a little-known real estate investor, Gary Barnett, bought the Belnord, a 1909 landmarked 12-story apartment building on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, bringing an end to one of the citys longest and most acrimonious tenant-landlord battles. He paid around $15 million and agreed to settle a slew of pending lawsuits.

title: Snared Into Prostitution at 13, and Now Given a Chance for a Clean Legal Slate
description: The summer she was 13, before she went into eighth grade, the child who would come to be known on police blotters under a half-dozen names began to stand on sidewalks in the Bronx and wait for men in cars to give her money for sex. Call her Leni Johnson.

title: Turkeys Leadership
description: The Arab Spring tour taken this month by Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey demonstrated the good and the bad of his increasingly confident leadership.

title: Promoting Citys Efforts on Health, to the World
description: Early in his political career, Michael R. Bloomberg confessed that a few positions interested him besides mayor of New York, including president of the World Bank and secretary general of the United Nations.

title: Ways to Prevent Cheating
description: The Board of Regents took an important step this month when it directed the New York State Education Department to develop a plan for eliminating glaring weaknesses in the state testing system. As a first move, the Regents voted to require that state tests for third through eighth grades be given on the same day all over the state. And, from now on, teachers and administrators will have to certify that they have received and will follow the same administrative protocols.

title: Fathers Role in Bank Venture Poses Test for Cuomo
description: ALBANY  At age 79, former Gov. Mario M. Cuomo wants to become a banker.

title: Marines Hit the Ground Running in Seeking Recruits at Gay Center
description: TULSA, Okla.  Master Sgt. Anthony Henry, a top Marine recruiting trainer for the southwestern United States, pulled up to Tulsas biggest gay community center on Tuesday morning and left his Chevy where he could make a fast getaway. I have an exit strategy, he said. I know where my choke points are, Ive strategically parked my car right on the curbside, I have an out.

title: Wednesday: Trouble Spots?
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Its hard to believe that this puzzle by Peter A. Collins is only a Wednesday. Its not that its difficult; there is just so much to appreciate here that it feels more like a Thursday or later week grid.

title: PepsiCo to Foster Chickpeas in Ethiopia
description: PepsiCo plans to announce a new venture on Wednesday aimed at increasing its access to chickpeas, which play an increasing role in its food products, and expanding production of the crop in Ethiopia.

title: Pursuing Identities, Police Disclose Details About L.I. Victims
description: YAPHANK, N.Y.  There were 10 bodies in all, thought to be the work of one or more serial killers, inexorably connected by the proximity of where they were found.

title: 8 Children Abducted by Mother, Police Say
description: Eight children were abducted from foster care in Queens on Monday during a visit with their mother, the police said on Tuesday.

title: Unusual Question to Jurors: How Do You Like the Mayor?
description: One after another, they stitched together a collage of thoughts about Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, responding as to whether they had formed opinions about him.

title: Woman Shot Her Husband in Hatred, Prosecutor Says
description: Prosecutors sought on Tuesday to portray Barbara Sheehan, the Queens woman accused of killing her husband, as having been a deeply unhappy wife who resented her sexless marriage and now was grossly exaggerating what she has called decades of physical abuse.

title: Lawyer for Man in Bomb Plot Sees No Conflict in Work for Undercover Detective
description: One of the lawyers representing a Queens man accused of plotting to blow up a synagogue also briefly represented the undercover detective who helped bring the case against the man.

title: Kansas City, Mo., School District Loses Its Accreditation
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  The struggling Kansas City, Missouri School District was stripped of its accreditation on Tuesday, raising the possibility of student departures and a state takeover. The action follows weeks of tumult that included another round of turnover of top leadership.

title: Outside Baseball Stadiums, a Solid Lineup
description: Statues depicting bygone baseball players seem to be multiplying, dressing up stadium grounds and serving as meeting places for fans.

title: Fill In the Blanks, Continued
description: My debut Op-Ed column on Monday, which attempted a dispassionate appraisal of what I called the Great Disappointment, prompted an outpouring of comments and e-mails and Tweets. Theres no way I can reply to all of them, but my plan with this and future columns is to sum up some of the main points from my many in-boxes, and respond as best I can.

title: Solyndra Executives to Invoke Fifth Amendment Rights
description: WASHINGTON  The top two executives of a solar-energy company that filed for bankruptcy after getting $528 million in loan guarantees from the Obama administration said Tuesday that they will invoke their constitutional rights against compelled self-incrimination when they appear at a Congressional hearing.

title: That Old Heritage Moon
description: From Earth, the Moon looks as though it is constantly changing. But, on the lunar surface where the only breeze is the solar wind, there is an eerie permanence. Witness the photographs of three of the Apollo landing sites taken recently by NASAs Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter. They show the undisturbed trails left by American astronauts on foot and in their moon buggy four decades ago.

title: The Re-election Tango
description: Whether Bill Clinton is being mischievous or helpful is never entirely clear. But the former president often manages to show the current president just how the game should be played.

title: Are We Going to Roll Up Our Sleeves or Limp On?
description: It becomes clearer every week that our country faces a big choice: We can either have a hard decade or a bad century.

title: Q&A: Spinning Tunes Over the Web
description: Q.

title: Battle for Libya | September 20, 2011
description: Libyan interim government forces stormed a house in Tripoli and friends and family buried the commander of a group of former rebel fighters in Misurata.

title: House G.O.P. Tightens Its Bond With Netanyahu
description: WASHINGTON  When the Obama administration wanted to be certain that Congress would not block $50 million in new aid to the Palestinian Authority last month, it turned to a singularly influential lobbyist: Israels prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Japan: Typhoon Approaches
description: Authorities in Nagoya, Japans fourth-largest city, advised more than one million people to leave on Tuesday as a powerful typhoon approached the densely populated region of central Japan. The city asked the military to assist in evacuating residents from low ground before the storm, Typhoon Roke, which was expected to reach the area on Wednesday. Heavy rains and flash flooding have been reported in mountainous areas.

title: Instagram Upgrades, Adds Filters and Increases Image Size
description: Fans of Instagram, the popular free iPhone photo-sharing app, has given users at least four new reasons to snap and share: It has added four new filters in an update.

title: Italy: 7 Go on Trial Over Quake
description: Seven Italian seismologists and scientists went on trial on manslaughter charges on Tuesday, accused of not adequately warning residents of a central Italian region before an earthquake that killed 309 people in April 2009. Prosecutors say that the seven defendants, members of a national panel that assesses major risks, played down the risk of a major earthquakes occurring even though there had been significant seismic activity near LAquila, the capital of the Abruzzo region, in the months before the quake. The case has drawn the attention of the international scientific community, which argues that it is impossible to predict an earthquake. Prosecutors, in actuality, charge that the panel did not fulfill its mandate and instead conveyed incomplete, imprecise and contradictory information.

title: Russia: Ruling on Oil Company
description: Both sides in the convoluted legal battle over Mikhail B. Khodorkovskys now-defunct Yukos Oil were claiming victory on Tuesday after the European Court of Human Rights ruled that Russia had violated the rights of company representatives to a fair trial, but failed to find evidence that Russian authorities had intentionally misused legal proceedings to bankrupt and dismantle the company. Yukos representatives had accused the Russian government of applying tax laws selectively in an effort to assume control of the company after Mr. Khodorkovsky was arrested in 2003.

title: Corrections: September 21
description: FRONT PAGE

title: A Change in Statehouse Politics
description: Following are excerpts from an interview conducted with Gov. Jerry Brown of California by The New York Times at his office in Sacramento last Friday.

title: A.L. Race Rages, but Yankees Stay Above It
description: The Yankees have higher priorities on their agenda than helping their old friends, the Boston Red Sox, hang on to their wild-card spot. The Yankees have yet to clinch their own playoff berth, let alone the American League East title, so for now, beating any opponent will do.

title: Rested Mets Cant Cool Off Cardinals
description: ST. LOUIS  The Mets have found themselves in the thick of the playoff hunt after all.

title: Gucci: Spring 2012 RTW
description: Milan

title: G.O.P. Urges No Further Fed Stimulus
description: Even though the financial markets have been counting on the Federal Reserve to take action, Republican Congressional leadership sent a letter to the Federal Reserve chairman on Tuesday evening urging it not to engage in further stimulus.

title: Rethinking the Exercise Talk Test
description: Many of us rely on the so-called talk test to gauge a workouts intensity. It is such a simple measure, consisting of only one question: Can you speak aloud while working out? If so, conventional wisdom says, you are exercising at the right intensity to improve both your health and fitness.

title: Word of the Day | cloying
description: cloying \kli-iN, kliN\ adjective

title: Tom Wilson, Cartoonist Behind Ziggy, Dies at 80
description: Who is this comic-strip character named Ziggy? He cant be placed in time, location or economic status, and seems to be  but may not be  an adult male. It is known that he was created in 1969 by the cartoonist Tom Wilson, who died on Friday, and who suggested that Ziggy can be whatever you want him to be.

title: Mohammed Ghani Hikmat, Iraqi Sculptor, Dies at 82
description: Mohammed Ghani Hikmat, the Iraqi sculptor who created many of Baghdads most famous landmarks and who led the effort to recover works of art looted from the National Museum of Iraq after the fall of Saddam Hussein, died on Sept. 12 in Amman, Jordan, where he had gone for medical treatment. He was 82.

title: Christopher Cokes Letter to Sentencing Judge
description: A letter from Christopher Coke, the convicted Jamaican drug dealer, to Judge Robert P. Patterson Jr., asking for lenience in sentencing.

title: NYT Front Page for 09/21/11
description: NYT Front Page for 09/21/11

title: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Wednesday
description: Congress General Secretary Rahul Gandhi will travel to Sikkim on Wednesday to meet victims of Sundays devastating earthquake and their families.(CNN-IBN) The official death toll in Sundays powerful temblor has shot up to 68 in India, including 53 in the Himalayan state, while more than 3,000 people have been rescued by defense forces. Many parts of northern Sikkim are still inaccessible, and hundreds of people are still searching for relatives. (Hindustan Times)

title: Universities Seeking Out Students of Means
description: Money is talking a bit louder in college admissions these days, according to a survey to be released Wednesday by Inside Higher Ed, an online publication for higher education professionals.

title: If Citi Field Changes,  It Wont Be Subtle
description: General Manager Sandy Alderson on Tuesday night offered the strongest indication yet that the Mets would make significant alterations to the dimensions of the field at their home stadium during the off-season.

title: Desperately Seeking the Aerostat
A Violent Pastime
description: With some serious injuries dotting the beginning of the N.F.L. season, William C. Rhoden asks if perhaps our national love for football has made us blind to its dangers.

title: A Violent Pastime
description: With some serious injuries dotting the beginning of the N.F.L. season, William C. Rhoden asks if our national love for football has made us blind to its dangers.

title: In Turkey, Game Day Becomes Ladies Night
description: The Turkish soccer federations new answer to fan violence  barring men from the games of teams punished for it  got its first test on Tuesday at a game between Fenerbahce and Manisaspor in Istanbul.

title: Sept. 21, 1938 | Giant Hurricane Lashes Long Island and New England
description: On Sept. 21, 1938, a giant hurricane roared up the Eastern Seaboard, causing extensive damage and loss of life on Long Island and much of New England, not relenting until it had crossed into Canada.

title: News Quiz | Sept. 21, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Sept. 21, 2011
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Scott Matthews at Math for America from the article Pipeline Spills Put Safeguards Under Scrutiny.

title: The Wild Dolphin Project
description: WHO is Denise L. Herzing?

title: Common Moments That Still Exist
description: Farzana Wahidy graduated from the photojournalism program at Loyalist College in Ontario, Canada. Ms. Wahidy, 27, was born in Kandahar, Afghanistan, and raised in Kabul, where she is a freelance photographer. Her conversation with Kim Nowacki, part of the Turning Point series, has been edited and condensed.

title: How Much Do You Gossip?
description: How much time do you spend every day gossiping, or listening to gossip  whether in person or online? Do think think gossiping is dangerous? Do you think you could refrain from gossip for an entire day? (A 2008 Times article reported on a school in which students were asked to stop for just an hour at a time.) What are some the consequences of gossip that youve observed in your own life?

title: Tip of the Week: Safaris New Reading List
description: The latest version of Apples Safari browser for Windows and Mac OS X includes a Reading List feature that lets you quickly save Web pages for later perusal. To save a Web page on screen, go to Safaris Bookmarks menu and choose the Add to Reading List option. You can also press Control-Shift-D in Windows or Command-Shift-D on a Mac to save the current page to the Reading List. And you can Shift-click on a link within a Web page to save that article to the Reading List without opening it.

title: American Hikers Leave Iran After Prison Release
description: Two American hikers imprisoned on espionage charges in Iran were released Wednesday after days of conflicting signals, ending diplomatic skirmishing that complicated the United States already fraught relationship with Tehran for more than two years.

title: Line2 HD Adds Phone Features To The iPad
description: Line2 HD may not be the first app to turn your iPad into a phone, but it is an easy-to-use addition that puts phone calls, texts, voicemail and e-mail on a single screenand offers a stack of other features as well.

title: A New York Artist Takes the Long View of Customizer Culture
description: Decepcin, the title of Luis Gisperts show at the uptown Mary Boone Gallery, at 745 Fifth Avenue, translates from the Spanish not to its English cognate, but more literally to disillusionment or disappointment. The word applies to the effect of the huge photographs in the show, which depict fantasy landscapes seen through the windshields of luxury vehicles.

title: 8 Months After First Protests, Yemen Enters Dangerous New Phase
description: SANA, Yemen  Eight months after the first protesters began calling for revolution in Yemen, the beleaguered country has entered a new round of violence, in which street demonstrators appear to have become little more than sacrificial pawns in a long-term rivalry among members of Yemens political elite.

title: The Logic of Cutting Payroll Taxes
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

title: N.F.L. Week 2 Film Review
description: A look back at some of the matchups in Week 2, via film analysis:

title: At Berlin Show, One Photographers View of the Post-Sept. 11 World
description: As 9/11 memorials go up around the globe, one of Berlins pre-eminent spaces for photography is focusing on the era of global unrest that resulted from that fateful day. Through Dec. 10, C/O Berlin (Oranienburger Strasse 35/36; 49-30-28-44-41-661; www.co-berlin.info) will host At War, featuring pieces by Anja Niedringhaus, a German Associated Press photographer  and the only woman on a team of 11 A.P. photographers that won a Pulitzer in 2005.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Erdem
description: Erdems girl is no longer estranged from her paramour, as she was for fall. Instead, this spring, shes channeling the film In the Mood for Love and hair and makeup are following suit. For the show, Andrew Gallimore created what he described as a cinematic blurry lip using M.A.C.s new Scarlet Ibis lip color set with powder and then patted with Pigment in Red. Hot n Saucy Tendertones served as allover blush to complement roughed-up, more boyish brows. For hair, Marc Tringer created a clean, bouncy ponytail using Charles Worthington Front Row Heat Defence Spray before blow-drying and separating the hair into three or four sections and curling with a small-barrel iron to create a slight bend at the ends. It was romance all the way.

title: For University of Wisconsin, New Facebook Fans Pay Off
description: The value of a follower on Twitter or Facebook can be nebulous  unless youre the University of Wisconsin-Madison this month.

title: The Synth Punks
description: Youve gone back to friggin guitar, bass and drums, how can that be the future? Bloody hell.
