description: Todays Times

title: India Quake Toll Rises After Plant Confirms Workers Deaths
description: NEW DELHI  The death toll in the earthquake that shook the northeastern Indian state of Sikkim on Sunday rose as a company building a huge hydroelectric power plant in the region confirmed on Wednesday that 17 of its workers had died and seven were critically injured.

title: Bomb Suspected in Explosion of Car in Michigan
description: 6:40 a.m. Sept. 22 | Updated  A bomb may have been placed underneath the vehicle and detonated as they were driving, the authorities said Wednesday, as my colleague Timothy Williams reports:

title: U.S. Expresses Concern About New Cyberattacks in Japan
description: TOKYO  The United States gave a stern warning on Wednesday over recent cyberattacks on Japans biggest defense contractors, the latest in a series of security breaches that have fueled concern about Tokyos ability to handle delicate information.

title: SABMiller to Buy Fosters for $10.15 Billion
description: 8:00 p.m. | Updated

title: New Designer Alert | Jennifer Chun
description: The starting point for Jennifer Chuns spring collection was a grainy, paparazzi-style photo of the Yves Saint Laurent muses Betty Catroux and Loulou de la Falaise casually flanking Laurent on a London sidewalk. It shows how real women wore his designs on the street, says Chun, who worked at Michael Kors, Derek Lam and Brian Reyes before starting her namesake line of practical and utilitarian clothes. Making her New York Fashion Week debut at the recent Gen Art show, a group runway that spotlights emerging designers, Chun presented spring looks that elegantly mix fashions masculine and feminine. I definitely wouldnt say theyre androgynous. They arent literal interpretations of mens pieces, she explains. You dont want it to become too costumey. Im more interested in functionality. In Chuns gender blender, a khaki boyfriend blazer is paired with a cropped top; a long, creamy silk dress bears a baseball raglan. Everything appears to be designed for women who dont spend all day planning outfits. This is for a city girl, she says. I never leave the house without a blazer, without a trench coat  so those will be my signatures.

title: Generic Drug Savings Promoted by Industry Group
description: Generic drugs saved consumers and the government $931 billion over the last decade, an industry group said on Wednesday in a report promoting policy changes to increase savings further.

title: Unfinished Business
description: On paper, business is about marketing, management and finance. In reality, it is also about relationships: the good, the bad and the ugly.

title: The Other India: The Weavers of Varanasi
description: Since the beginning of this year, Sonia Faleiro has been traveling across Indias small towns and villages, meeting farmers, weavers, teachers, tamasha troupes, small-time politicians, Panchayat members, pickle-makers, housewives, and circus artists to gather reporting for her next book. In this regular feature for India Ink she will send postcards from her travels, providing a glimpse of the people and places whose stories are seldom told.

title: Pessimism Fills Kabul During Mourning for Slain Peace Council Chief
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Hamid Karzai landed at Kabul International Airport as dusk fell here Wednesday and faced a country even more fearful and divided than the one he had left just three days ago.

title: On Our Radar: Typhoon Buffets Tokyo
description: A powerful typhoon lashes Tokyo, halting trains and stranding tens of thousands of commuters. It seems headed toward the nations tsunami-ravaged northeastern coast, raising fears of another inundation at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant. [Associated Press]

title: U.S. Ready to Face Wounded Australia
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand  Playing one of rugbys superpowers was never going to be easy for the United States Eagles, and their task Friday might have become a lot tougher when Australia lost to Ireland last weekend in the Rugby World Cup.

title: And Now a Word From the Director
description: IN 1938, a month after the Nazi assault on German Jews known as Kristallnacht made headlines across the world, Walt Disney gave Hitlers pet filmmaker, Leni Riefenstahl, a tour of his studio. He showed her some Mickey Mouse sketches, and she offered to show him Olympia, her cinematic slog through the 1936 Berlin Olympics. He turned her down because he was worried it would get out that he was playing host to a woman most of Hollywood shunned. In his biography Leni Steven Bach writes that when she returned to Germany, she praised Disney for receiving her, saying, it was gratifying to learn how thoroughly proper Americans distance themselves from the smear campaigns of the Jews.

title: Billy Beane of Moneyball Has Given Up on His Own Hollywood Ending
description: Billy Beane has a wonderful story. At 18 he was a strapping young baseball prospect, raised in San Diego by a Naval-officer dad and drafted fresh out of high school in the first round by the New York Mets. He was a sure star  until he suddenly wasnt, his playing career faltering for reasons few could understand, least of all him. Then, at 27, a journeyman outfielder with a lifetime average of .219 whod bounced from the Mets to the Twins to the Tigers to the As, he walked out of the dugout and into the teams front office, looking for a job. He became a scout, and eight years later, he was promoted to general manager of a losing team. Under his watch, the As, a small-market underdog with a minuscule payroll, made the playoffs five times in the next eight seasons.

title: The Surreal Ruins of Qaddafis Never-Never Land
description: On the evening of Aug. 23, during the final hours of the battle for Tripoli, a 26-year-old lawyer named Mustafa Abdullah Atiri was lying, exhausted, against the back wall of a filthy tin-roofed warehouse crammed with 150 prisoners. He had been beaten and tortured every day since Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis soldiers arrested him four days earlier. It was just after the muezzins first call to evening prayer  about 10 minutes before 8  when a pair of guards walked to the door, raised their AK-47 rifles and began spraying the men with bullets. Another guard threw a grenade into the densely packed crowd. Bodies fell on top of Atiri with the first fusillade, protecting him from the blast. Then the guards opened fire again. Blood began seeping down from the bodies above, soaking his jeans. As the officers walked back across the yard to reload, a guard named Abdel Razaq, who had shown the men some small mercies over the previous days, went to the door and shouted at the survivors: Run! Run!

title: Maestros Injury Ignites Game of Musical Chairs
description: A man falls in Vermont. Classical music shudders.

description: Rearden Commerce, an e-commerce platform company, announced on Wednesday that it had raised $133 million, valuing the company at $1.35 billion.

title: CRT Capital Hires Citadel Team
description: Another team is departing the securities unit at Kenneth C. Griffins hedge fund giant, Citadel.

title: 2012 Could Be Tiebreaker of Last 2 Cycles
description: American politics is a continual exercise in course correction. But the ship of state has been tacking especially erratically for the past few election cycles.

title: Billionaires and Secretaries
description: Well, it seems as if a number of people in the media have decided that Obama was fibbing when he said that some millionaires pay lower tax rates than their secretaries  because, as the usual suspects triumphantly declare, on average millionaires pay higher average taxes than middle-income Americans.

title: Freudian Headlines
description: Maybe (probably) Im reading too much into this, but I was struck by this FT headline: IMF warning over stimulus policies. Because if you actually read the story, the IMF is actually warning about austerity policies.

title: In a City of Reinvention, Genius Finds a Home
description: It was good to see New York getting its stride back when the latest batch of genius awards were announced on Tuesday by the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation. For a couple of years, the city had few winners and seemed to be slipping. The 2011 list, with 4 New Yorkers among the 22 grant recipients, is more like it.

title: Perry Video Calls Obama President Zero
description: UPDATE 1:10 p.m.: Ahead of Thursdays debate in Orlando, Fla., the presidential campaign of Gov. Rick Perry of Texas released a Web video on Wednesday that offers a grim picture of a broken economy presided over by President Zero.

title: Constraints on Central Banks Leave Markets Adrift
description: They called it the Greenspan put, and it reassured a generation of traders. If economic storms were gathering, the top central banks  most important the Federal Reserve, then led by Alan Greenspan  could and would step in to prevent disaster.

title: Samurai Shopper | Nailed It
description: The Samurai Shopper is happy to close the book on summer, especially the part where everyone wears open-toed shoes or flip-flops and I have to look at tawdry toenails done up in honky-tonk hues. Why am I looking at toenails? Not for dark, pervy reasons: usually to avoid eye contact with the unhinged element that has, of late, turned mass transport and many sidewalks into halfway houses.

title: Mickey Mouse Has Some New Moves for Toddlers
description: Im the mouse thats gonna rock the house!

title: New Developments in the Political Business Cycle
description: Theres a well-established line of work in economics on the political business cycle, starting with a paper by my original mentor Bill Nordhaus (pdf). The basic idea was that since voters tend to have short memories, it pays for a government to reflate the economy centering on the proposition that government have an incentive to reflate the economy in the period leading up to an election, even if this imposes costs that will have to be paid later. Concern about this issue is one reason for central bank independence.

title: Wednesday Reading: Rethinking the Exercise Talk Test
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: E.C.B. Takes Steps to Ease Cash Crunch at Continent's Banks
description: LONDON  The European Central Bank took further steps Wednesday to ease a cash crunch at the Continents banks, as the International Monetary Fund warned that the sovereign debt crisis would require a huge increase in bank reserves.

title: In N.F.L., the Cost of Doing Business Through the Air
description: For excitement, the first two weeks of the N.F.L. season have exceeded expectations. Scoring and passing yardage are at near-record levels, and Sundays Dallas-San Francisco game was just one example of the many games that have been decided by big passing plays at the finish.

title: Tony Bennett Apologizes for 9/11 Comments in Radio Interview
description: Tony Bennett has apologized on his Facebook page for remarks he made on Howard Sterns radio show suggesting that the United States had caused the Sept. 11 attacks.

title: As World Leaders Meet, Global Unemployment Is Topic No. 1
description: FRANKFURT  What do the Arab Spring, the London riots and the Greek debt crisis have in common? They have all happened in environments of rampant joblessness. In fact, it might not be far off to say that a big share of the worlds political and economic turmoil is fueled in one way or another by unemployment.

title: Treasury to Auction 17.9 Million SunTrust Warrants
description: The Treasury Department said on Wednesday that it would auction off more than 17.9 million warrants that it holds in SunTrust Banks, as the government continues to wind down holdings it gained through its bailout of the financial industry.

title: Typhoon Headed for Stricken Japanese Nuclear Plant
description: TOKYO  A powerful typhoon struck Japans main island on Wednesday, stranding thousands of commuters in Tokyo and poured heavy rain on the stricken Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant in the nations tsunami-ravaged northeast.

description: Last Saturday morning, a van pulled up outside a Riverside Drive apartment building at 100th Street in Manhattan, and the driver hauled out a worn, wooden case of thick glass seltzer bottles, which his teenage helper tried to hoist onto his shoulder.

title: Unheeded Tornado Warnings Just One Lesson from Joplin
description: The National Weather Service published a detailed and valuable report yesterday examining factors contributing to the extraordinary loss of life in Joplin, Mo., after a great swath of the community was shredded by a tornado at the top of the enhanced Fujita scale of destructiveness.

description: Teacups in hand and butter biscuits within reach, a handful of local technology titans debated the future of some young Indian entrepreneurs on a summer Saturday. After grilling five teams over several hours, the group, the Indian Angel Network, put two promising start-ups on the shortlist for potential financing.

title: Obama Says Palestinians Are Using Wrong Forum
description: UNITED NATIONS  President Obama declared his opposition to the Palestinian Authoritys bid for statehood through the Security Council on Wednesday, throwing the weight of the United States directly in the path of the Arab democracy movement even as he hailed what he called the democratic aspirations that have taken hold throughout the Middle East and North Africa.

title: Girls Who Dress Up
description: Are there any little girls left who wouldnt be caught dead in a dress? Who moan and groan when forced to doll up, and beg instead to wear their big brothers old jeans?

title: Locked in a Box, With Plants as a Lifeline
description: What do you get when you lock yourself in an airtight box for 48 hours with no source of oxygen other than 150 house plants? A blinding headache, according to Iain Stewart, a professor of geosciences who nonetheless survived the ordeal to demonstrate the interdependence of humans and plants.

title: The Importance of Pet Tags
description: Is your dog or cat wearing a collar and tags?

title: After Abduction of 8 Children, Sense That Mother Was Desperate
description: They had been going to counseling and parenting classes. They had impressed foster care officials with their apparent diligence and devotion to their eight children, who had been removed from their home because of accusations of abuse.

title: Frank Oz Will Pay a Visit to Jim Hensons Fantastic World
description: For fans of the Muppets theres more than one great and powerful Oz who has shaped their cultural consciousness. Theres the literary character, and then theres the very real Frank Oz, the director and Muppeteer, who will be making a special appearance at the Museum of the Moving Image in Astoria, Queens, in conjunction with its presentation of Jim Hensons Fantastic World, the museum said on Wednesday.

title: Thinking About Moving to the Cloud? There Are Trade-Offs
description: Most businesses, whether they realize it or not, already have at least a foot in the cloud. If they use Gmail, for example, they are going into the cloud to let Googles computers handle e-mail.

title: Dispute on Disaster Aid Threatens Bill to Avert Government Shutdown
description: WASHINGTON  A dispute between the House and Senate over money for disaster relief is threatening a short-term bill to finance the government after Sept. 30, raising the prospect of a government shutdown if the disagreement cannot be resolved.

title: Colleges Increasingly Look for Applicants Who Can Pay Full Price
description: College admissions directors are increasingly interested in the depth of an applicants pockets, according to a report released Wednesday by Inside Higher Ed, an education news Web site.

title: How to Get the Highest Price for Your Used Car
description: Looking to sell your car and get a new one? The path of least resistance is to trade in your used vehicle at the dealership. But youll probably end up with significantly more cash if you sell it yourself.

title: Mapping a Stripe of the Seafloor
description: Bernard Coakley, a marine geologist with the University of Alaska at Fairbanks, writes from the Arctic Ocean, where his team is reconstructing the geologic history of the Chukchi Shelf and the Chukchi Borderland.

title: Davis Is Executed in Georgia
description: JACKSON, Ga.  Proclaiming his innocence, Troy Davis was put to death by lethal injection on Wednesday night, his life  and the hopes of supporters worldwide  prolonged by several hours while the Supreme Court reviewed but then declined to act on a petition from his lawyers to stay the execution.

title: The Distributional Effect of Tax Cuts  A Brief Note
description: With taxes on the wealthy on the political radar, were going to drowning in a vast wave of double-talk and smothered by vast amounts of fuzzy math. Still, one has to try. So, a couple of notes.

title: Does Moving to the Cloud Pay Off?
description: Ive just written a small-business guide to the pros and cons of moving to the cloud  that is, to enlisting information-technology services that you access via a Web site instead of installing software that runs on your computers. One of the crucial issues for small-business owners, as always, is cost, and though I look at cost trade-offs in the guide, Id like to say just a bit more here specifically on the question of how expensive it is to transition to the cloud.

title: Poll Finds Support Among Small Businesses for Tougher Fuel Economy Standards
description: Findings from a new poll contradict the prevailing wisdom that small-business owners are focused on the twin burdens of regulation and high taxes. Owners are instead more concerned about economic uncertainty and higher costs, including expensive fuel.

title: Ouster of Hewlett-Packard C.E.O. Is Expected
description: Hewlett-Packard, the technology giant that has stumbled through repeated embarrassments, was preparing on Wednesday to fire its chief executive, less than one year after naming him to the post, according to several people with knowledge of the boards actions.

title: Cathy Horyn Interviews Alber Elbaz
description: Cathy Horyn asks Alber Elbaz about his fall collection for Lanvin, and the lines promotional video.

title: Back to the Law: Former Cuomo Aide Moves On
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos former top aide, Steven M. Cohen, has landed in the private sector two months after he left the administration, taking a job at a Washington-based law firm that is seeking to increase its presence in New York City.

title: Giants Hixon Has Torn A.C.L.
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Giants announced Wednesday that Domenik Hixon tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee  the same injury that forced him to miss the entire 2010 season  and would undergo surgery in the near future. He was placed on injured reserve and will miss the rest of the season.

title: Two Men Arrested in Killing of TV Reporter in China
description: BEIJING  The police in central Henan Province have arrested two men suspected of killing a television reporter whose microblog posting touched on a scandal involving the illegal reuse of cooking oil, the state media reported Wednesday.

title: Media Matters Takes a Stab at Satellite Radio
description: 2:48 p.m. | Updated Media Matters for America, the media monitoring group that directs most of its ire at Fox News and talk radio, is getting a radio show of its own, albeit temporarily.

title: A More Perfect Union: Tom Six Discusses The Human Centipede II
description: It is entirely possible  maybe even likely  that you know the plot of Tom Sixs horror movie The Human Centipede (First Sequence) without having seen a single frame of it. After receiving a modest theatrical release in the United States last year, the film has become a cult sensation as a video-on-demand offering and been referred to on mainstream shows like South Park and The Colbert Report because of its simple, memorable and thoroughly unnerving premise: a mad doctor who surgically combines three human captives into a single organism by stitching them together, mouth to anus.

title: Whose Belly Did I Come From?
description: How to talk to children about  ? How young is too young? Or have you already waited longer than you should?

title: Young Adults Make Gains in Health Insurance Coverage
description: Young adults, long the group most likely to be uninsured, are gaining health coverage faster than expected since the 2010 health law began allowing parents to cover them as dependents on family policies.

title: JBird, a New Speakeasy in Midtown
description: THE saturation point for speakeasies was breached several years ago, but they continue to sprout up behind taco stands, coffee shops and beauty salons. The latest is JBird, a hidden cocktail bar that opened in August just north of Times Square. While it lacks novelty, it doubles down on absurd inconvenience: guests must navigate a velvet rope shared with a nightclub, a dark hallway, an elevator, another corridor and a bleak staircase humming with ice machines.

title: Try a Private Jet, at Public Prices
description: FLYING in a private jet may not be as far out of reach as you think. Though its still not cheap, prices are rivaling first- and business-class tickets  and even, occasionally, coach  thanks in part to new Web sites, social media and a greater willingness by charter companies and private jet brokers to negotiate in an era of high fuel prices.

title: Movie Sets by Heisler
description: Movie sets n NYC

title: FIFA Rankings: For Amusement Purposes Only
description: Many of those old-school pinball machines used to display a caveat should anyone dare to consider a wager on a game: For Amusement Purposes Only.

title: London Design Festival | Site Specific
description: For the third year in a row, the London Design Festival has made its headquarters at the Victoria & Albert Museum, with designers creating installations that are contemporary responses to aspects of the museums building or collections. Ben Evans, the director of the L.D.F., and Suzanne Trocme, its curator, work closely with the museums curators on the project. It takes 51 weeks of planning for the 10 days of the festival, Trocme says, only half in jest.

title: In Florida, Romney Belittles Perry on Social Security
description: MIAMI  One day before Republicans gather for a presidential debate in Florida, Mitt Romney intensified his criticism on Wednesday of Gov. Rick Perrys position on Social Security and belittled the concept of turning the federal program over to states or local governments.

Yankees Scratch Hughes From Start Against Rays
